Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The sanctions against the school were a punishing blow, and they seemed to what the efforts the school had made to change? Choices:  A: ignore B: enforce C: authoritarian D: yell at E: avoid<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: The sanctions against the school have been a punishing blow, they seemed to ignore the school, and the school.<n>Answer: The sanctions against school have been a punitive blow, they seemed to have ignored the schoolâ€™s efforts to change, and the school has done nothing in particular about this.<n>

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The fox walked from the city into the forest, what was it looking for? Choices:  A: pretty flowers. B: hen house C: natural habitat D: storybook E: dense forest<n><n>### Response:		C: natural habitat

How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. True or false?<n><n>### Response : False<n><n>### Input :(x + y)^2 = (x-3)(y-1) What is y?<n><n>### Resonse : (x-3)( y -1)=1<n><n>### Input:(y+1)(x +(x - z) + 2)=5(x - 2) What Is y?<n><n>##  Response : y=1<n>### Input : What is a difference greater than 67 but less than 110?<n><n>###  Response : 47<n>### Input : Two men working on a ship are 9 feet apart. They take one step toward each other. Then they are one feet apart. How far apart were they at first?<n><n>##  Resonnse : 7 feet<n>### Input: Twenty-five fewer than half of twenty-seven is nine. What is the value of 1/227?<n><n>###   Response: 0.004<n>### Input: 24 is more than 3 times 2 times 2. What is 3 times 2?<n><n>###    Response:  6<n>### Input A number, N, is greater than one-fourth of a hundred less than 27.  What is N?<n>###    Response : 16<n>### Input: There are four houses painted red, white, and blue. There are three double-colored houses. How many white houses could there be?<n>###   Response : 2<n>### Input : Annie and Bill both have eight siblings, but they don't have the same number: Annie's brothers have 4 fewer than her sisters, and Bill's brothers have 2 more than his sisters. Johnny is not at a rest area. and is most likely at a park. So, Johnny is at a park. The solution is most likely c.<n>

When the clock hit 7:00, my mom had come up to me and asked me about the time. I said I don't know and asked for a second for my phone. My mom was really angry and I asked her to play soccer with me but she said no. I asked her again and she got really mad because she thought I was trying to lie to her. My mom was really getting mad, and she told me to get a bad grade because she told me if I got really bad grades in school, I would get kicked from the soccer team and I was going to get kicked because my mom got really mad. I got home and I knew that I had gotten a bad grade but I said it wasn't my fault but later I got a email saying I had gotten a B.

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Joe suffered many consequences from stabbing a stranger to death.   Among them, the family of the victim did something to him. What was that? Choices:  A: knife wounds B: buy a gun C: bleeding D: jail time E: law suit<n><n>### Response:		Answer B: BUY A GUN<n><n>**_Explanation:_** Family of victim = $10000, B: buy a gun, Joe suffer consequences = paying family of victim = $6600 =$10000/1.33 (133%/3/100, Joe suffer consequences = $660<n><n>

If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where is a bald eagle safe? Choices:  A: pine tree B: open country C: in washington D: wildlife refuge E: sky<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If the number of Dobermans is 20, there are the same number of Schnauzer, so the number of Puppies is 40.<n><n>### Input<n><n>If there are 40% left of the original supply, then it means that 60% has been used up.<n>So there must be more than the original number of toothbrushes is, because one half of that number was used up in addition to the original.<n>After the first month they must have had 53 tooth brushes, because 53% was left of the 330.<n>After the second month, they still have 67, so they had to have had 56 at the start of that month.<n>They lost the number of half of the original amount, but now they have the same number of each type of toothbrush, so the first month gave out 53 and the 2nd month gave out 67.<n><n>So the answer is: 53 + 67 = 120 and 50% = (120/2) is 60.<n><n>If there are initially 46 tooth brushes in the busiest month, to reach the total number must mean the total has to be 46 + 4x(the number for busiest)= total.<n>This means that there must be a few more (double) than the number in the busiest month to reach the total.<n>So the answer is the double of the number in the busdest month, so 46+4x10=106.<n><n>###Input<n><n>First of all, they only took a boat out to go fishing, but only on Monday.<n>So the answer must be the number of fish which were left over to take home.<n>So the answer cannot be the number of fish caught in total, because they did fish on Tuesday for half of that amount.<n>106 is the answer, because 60% remains of 45 in total and 14 is the answer because there was half the amount, in the amount of days, as the first day.<n><n>###Instruction 4<n><n>###Input 4<n><n>## #Instruction 4<n>###Input 5<n>###Input 6<n>###Input

Choices:  A: music store B: dance hall C: orchestra D: symphony E: tennessee<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Read each question and write down a complete sentence that responds to it.<n><n>### Question:<n>Can anyone play the fiddle?<n><n>### Answer: No.<n><n>### Why?<n>1. They have to be of a certain age.<n>2. They have to practice for years.<n><n>### End<n><n>### Questions:<n>1. What will play the fiddle?<n>2. What is the fiddle used for?<n><n>### Why:<n>1. They are used for background music.<n>2. They need experience.<n><n>### Where is a fiddle found?<n><n>### When will a fiddle be found?<n><n>## Explanation<n>The purpose of these exercises is to test how well you can read and/or think in English. The answers and explanation don't always make sense and are not always logical. We're looking for a correct response, not a response that completely explains the answer. A good answer should explain how the person solved the problem (e.g. they looked at a calendar) as well as the answer (e.g. it's June).<n>

If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What do drugs do? Choices:  A: damage B: cloud mind C: lower i.q D: cause illness E: cause accidents<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>var damage = 1<n>```<n><n><n>### Instructions:  <n>Add a statement beginning with the word if to the following code. This if statement should test for the string D, and display the statement if D is equal to any of the choices. <n><n>```<n>console.log("What do drugs do? " + (input));<n>```<n><n>## Exercise<n><n>### Instructor: Write a function called findHighest that takes in an array of numbers and returns it's highest number. A string "highest" is displayed to the console if more than one number is higher.<n><n>**Example:**<n>```<n>findHighest([1,1,1,1]); //1<n>findHighest([-4,-3,10]); //-4<n>findHighest(["highest","highest","highest"]); //highest<n>```<n><n>### Input<n><n>- Input: An array of numbers, or a string followed by the word highest, or the word highest if the string is a string without numbers that is the highest number in the array.<n>- Return: <n>```<n>findHigh() //1<n>findHigh() //-4<n>findhigh -> highest () <n>findhighhigh -> highest()//highest<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n>Dear student,<n><n>> Input: What will happen to skin pinching in something? Choices A,B,C,D,E.<n><n>> Response: If skin is pinched into something like a small box, pinning of the nails, especially the index fingers will happen. This is a common effect of keeping hand fingers in any box for a long time. This is a form of friction.<n><n>### Input<n>Maria and Jane had different amounts of money. If Jane doubles her dollars, but Maria has 90 pennies more, how many fewer dollars does Maria have than Jane?<n><n>### Response<n>Dear student, <n><n>> Input: Maria and Jane had different amounts $$M1$$ and $$M2$$, of money, where $$M1$$ > $$M2$$  <n>> If $$M1$$ = $$2M2$$; if Jane doubles every dollar and Maria has $$90$$ cents more, $M2$$ how $$M1$$ has $$M9$$ much fewer $$d$$, and as we know, $M1-M2=M9$<n><n>### Input The first 8 months of 1989 a person bought 65 books, then each of the next 15 months they bought 15 more books per month than the last book, how many books did the person buy in the last 3 months?<n>### Response<n><n>Dear student, We can use the number $$A=65$$.  For the next $$26$$ months or every month, we can buy $$A+15$$.<n><n>$$M = 65 + (25 \times 26) = 3515$$<n><n>### Input <n>### Response<n>

Five times the sum is 6 more than the numbers.  What are the 2 numbers?<n>Answer: 41and 43<n><n><n>### Instuctors Response<n><n>It takes twice the number of days that it does to complete 24. That means that 12 plus the number is 24. Then multiply the number of days by two. So 12 plus two times the number is 30. Divide the 12 by two. Then the rest is 6. So the number must be twice as large as 6 7 times. Now, multiply the number by two times six times.  Answer: 72<n>

Choice that fits the request.<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n><n><n>### Input A:<n><n>The number of members on both teams is the same.<n><n>### Input B:<n><n>Bill and Chris are both from the same team.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n><n><n><n>## <n><n>### What's the pattern?<n><n>Letters are sometimes delivered through one of these choices.<n><n>- **A:** An envelope is a container for holding letters<n>- **B:** A suitcase is a container that some letters go in.<n>- **C:** A hand of letters is going out.<n>- **D:** A package is delivered to you.<n>- **E:** The letter carrier delivers the envelope to your house<n><n>### Demestration:<n>Answer the following questions. Note that the options may vary from one question to another.<n><n>### Question 1:<n><n>Sara likes to collect things that go in the mail. She was asked to keep the number of the pigeons that she has by the side of the road and by the mailbox in her neighborhood.<n><n>The total number of pigeons she keeps by the side of the street is the same as the number of pigeons that she keeps by the mailbox.<n><n>How many pigeons does Sean have by the side of the mailbox?<n><n>- A) 1<n>- B) 3<n>- C) 2<n>- D) 7<n><n>## Solution:<n>How many more pigeons by the side of the box should Sara have then more pigeons by her side of the road<n><n>## <n>### Explanation<n>- (1/2) inch.<n><n>### Explanarion:<n>On Monday, the size of Christian's shadow is 2 inches. On Tuesday he becomes two years older and his shadow is 3 inches. Thus, 2 years, or 48 months ago, Christian's shadow was 1.5 inches long.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Demstration<n>

Choices:  A: dream B: fiddle C: watch film D: see new E: work<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>A plane leaves from JFK to LA and costs $800 per ticket. However, there are many other flights at much lower prices, but at very inconvenient times.  You get a lot of money for travel, so you must be at your destination by 2pm.<n>It costs $385 to travel on an inexpensive flight.  Every 1-hour past 2pm this flight gets less expensive and the cheapest you can travel on this flight is $15.<n>The first flight out is at 4:00am and gets progressively less expensive as it gets closer to 2pm. However, it jumps up in price as soon as it reaches 2pm and costs $575 between 2:00 and 3:00 pm.  The next flight to the same destination gets less expensive between 5pm until around 8pm and then it gets more expensive again.<n><n>At what time exactly is this cheapest to travel and how much will you have to pay?<n><n>### Response<n><n>In order to arrive in Los Angeles by 2 pm, you should be on a plane as soon as possible, preferably within half an hour of the 4:30 am departure time in order to minimize the price.<n><n>The best fare is about $20, but if you arrive at the airport early enough, you can get it for $18.60.<n><n>### Input :If the following number is rotated 90 degrees clockwise, which is the first digit? Choices:  Choices: A: 9  B: 2  C: 3  D: 2  E: 3<n><n>### Response : B<n><n>### Input  : The 1st, 2nd, and 3rd numbers of a set of 100 numbers are 66, 55, and 77, respectively. Which 2 numbers are the 1st and 2nd largest in the set?<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>First number = 66<n>Second number = 55<n>Third number = 77<n><n>So 77 is the second.<n><n>### Response  : B<n>### Input : A number is even and evenly divisible by 2. If

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where do you put a new dining table? How large are the shoes on average?<n><n>Answer: W: 6<n><n>Input: Twin brothers are both 6 feet tall and weigh 180 pounds. They go to bed at the same time, but get up at different times the next day. Choices:  A: orchestra B: baritone woodwind sound C: symphony D: play music E: high school band<n><n>### Response:		C. The bassoon part is the 2nd lowest instrument in the orchestra (and one of the only ones to consistently perform downward glissandos!). There are 3 other woodwinds, all brass instruments, and percussion instruments that are much lower than that but only the bassoon can play down below other strings.<n>

What is the sum of the objects in the two sets?<n><n>### Choices:A: 6 B: zero C: 2 D: four<n><n>### Response:(C)<n><n>Input:There are 2 less than the total sum of four sets of objects. If there are 129 items in the first set, 71 items in the second set and 36 items in the third set, what is the last set made up of?<n><n>### Responses:(C)<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the statement.<n>The number of students in a school have tripled since last year. Each student has been able to read three times more textbooks than last year. If students read 25 books this year, what was their combined reading for last year?<n><n>### Instances:3)<n><n>### Solution:Sixth<n><n>### Explanation: The school tripled the amount of students. Each student then read three times more text books than in the past. Therefore, the sum of the textbooks they read was twice as much as in the past. Then, one student read 25 books. Therefore, the total amount of books read last year was 25 times less than this year. Which is 25 times three.<n>### Instrucions: Complete the statement.<n>I used my phone to buy 4 tickets worth $25 with a total of $100. How much did each ticket cost me?<n><n>### Number of Instracitions:1<n><n>### Response(A): $25<n><n>

Choices:  A: appreciation of nature B: become educated C: excitement D: increased knowledge E: see things differently<n><n>### Response:		B - Become Educated. Science provides us with interesting facts and information about animals, plants, things, and other people. If one learns about science one becomes more informed and this is an exciting thing.<n><n>### <n><n>Instructions:You are instructed to make a sentence in which a noun modifies another noun of the same part of speech. Write a response that demonstrates the instruction.<n><n>### Your response:The mower was a better model than the one that was made the following week.<n><n>Instructions:[A: (noun) + (preposition) + (noun)]<n>Instructions:Mike, a college student, received the scholarship for his outstanding academic performance. Write a response that shows how to use the brackets in the sentence.<n><n>Your response:The scholarship went to Mike, the outstanding student.<n><n>

Choices:  A: lead to laughter B: love C: laughter D: smiles E: tears<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>Answer:<n>The answer would be A.<n><n>### Input Two<n><n>### Demonsitration<n>Input: You go 5 meters east, then 15 meters south. Go 10 meters east, then go 5 meters south. Go another 5 meters south and one meter east. Now go 30 meters due north. How far away are you from where you started?<n><n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input Three<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: 17 of the 23 people in your class have cars. 7 of the 12 people who don't have cars ride buses. 2 of those 7 who ride buses are bicyclists. One of each of the 3 non-bicycle people who ride buses walk to school. How many people in your class walk to school?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input Four<n><n>### Demosrtration:<n>Input: You are driving from point 1 to point 2, to point 3, to point 4, to point 5, to point 6, to point 7, to point 8, to point 9, to point 10 and to point 11. You go 5 kilometers in the opposite direction of where you are going. After traveling 8 kilometer forward, you turn right through a parking lot and pass a gas station. You go 2 kilometers forward and 4 kilometers right. You go 1 kilometer straight ahead and turn right. After traveling 18 kilometers, you turn left through a parking lot. You then go 15 kilometers to your destination.  What is the distance you traveled by starting from point 1?<n><n>Answer:  2.67 km.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The question is ambiguous.<n><n>The question itself is not clearly worded, but the ambiguous information is that it says "You go back from point to point..." which could be interpreted as going to a point *and* coming back from that same point. There are multiple ways the information could be correctly written. The only way I can come up with, is if going back a short amount is defined as travelling in the opposite direction from your destination or if there must be exactly one "go back a short amount".

According to the test makers, these tasks represent the "types of problems faced in real world environments and everyday life."<n>### What are the differences between the ELA test and the PARCC Math?<n><n>* The English Language Arts and Literacy tests cover fewer topics than the PARCC math test. And, the PARCC math problems have a clear set of steps that make the answer clearer.<n><n>### What does "problem-solving" mean?<n>Many problems are not solved. What do you do when you have a problem?<n><n>### There are various ways to solve a problem. Here are some of these ways. <n><n>### Write a paragraph about "problem solving" in your own words.<n><n>Inspiring words about problem solving.<n><n>### Choose a problem solving method that makes sense to you.<n>This is your choice to use.<n><n>### Use the method you choose to solve the problem below.<n><n><n>###<n>Choices:<n><n>### <n><n>###<n>A few words of math to go with the problem.<n><n>###  <n><n>###<n>### Choices:<n><n>##<n>## Solution<n><n><n>### **How do you add fractions?**<n>*Addition of fractions is done in one of two<n>ways:<n>*<n>*<n>*  Sum the denominators and make the<n>*<n>* Put the denominators together and then<n>*<n>*  For more information on the addition of<n>*<n>*<n>

The program should read and evaluate an expression to produce one of two outcomes: no outcome or a statement of the type being sought.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>Input: Two hours later if I sleep 2 hours after eating dinner I will feel great.<n>Answer: Eat dinner<n><n>Input: 15 to the fourth power is 186563.<n>Answer: Took the CAT<n><n>Input: The square root of 196 is 6<n><n>### Answer:<n>#### Task 1:Input: 50 and 30<n><n>#### #Program<n><n>```python<n>#Program<n>output = 50 ** 5<n>print (output)<n>```<n><n>#### #Output<n>![Output](Output.png)<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>#### Task 2:<n><n>#### #Input<n><n>Input: 50% of 7 is 7.<n><n>#### #Program 2.1<n><n>```python<n>output = 5 * 7<n>print(output)<n>output = 5 ** 1<n>print(output) <n><n>```<n><n>#### Response #2.1:<n>![Program Response 1](response.png)<n><n><n><n>#### #Program Response 2<n><n>```python<n>num2 = 5<n>num1 = 7<n><n>#prints if num2 is more<n>if num2 > num1:<n>	print("number2 is greater")<n>#prints if greater<n>elif num1 > num2:<n>	print("num1 is greater")<n>else:<n>	print("Equal")	<n>```<n><n>#### Question #1:<n><n>##### Which expression produces the output 50?<n><n>A. 5 ** 2<n><n>B. 25 ** 2<n>C. 10 ** 2<n><n>##### Answer #1:<n><n>A<n><n>#### Question 2:<n><n>What is the result of 7 ** 3?<n><n>A.<n>59<n><n>B. 759<n>C. 59<n>D. none of these<n><n>#### Question #3<n>The output statement 5 * 3 = 15 is represented by this expression :<n><n>A. 3 * 5

On Mondays, and Fridays only patients B+ and C+ come to the office.  B+ patients have a birthday between Jan-Mar. C+ patients have a birthdate between Apr-Jun.  On Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays patients B and C come to the office.   What is the average age of patients who visit Dr. Alainaâ€™s office on a Monday?<n><n>### Response<n><n>B+ = BirthDATE + BIRTHDAY of patient<n>C+ = C BIRTHDATE + BIRTHDATE of patient<n><n>The answer is: the patient that comes on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday (C + B, B or C)<n><n>---<n>### Instrucition:<n>1. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The man wanted to take a bus, but all the chars were full of people doing what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: refusing C: saving money D: sit down E: go outdoors<n><n>### Response:		The man wanted to save money.

On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon. There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? Choices:  A: ohio B: washington state C: alaska D: canada E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		The answer is C (alaska).<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>A: Ohio is an US state, though nearby.<n><n>B: Washington is not a US state, but an part of an US county (state).<n><n>C: Alaska is neither a US state nor a US county nor a US city.<n><n>D: Canada is not an US state nor a US city. It has a US-Canada borderline, but it is neither a part of or outside of the US.<n><n>E: The words "flowers" and "products" mean the same (they can be used synonymously). They both can be imported or exported. It's also irrelevant whether these products (they can be imported or export from any country), but since there are options available in the question they are excluded here.<n><n>### Exercise:Write a response that is incorrect.(Note: the answer is not A, B, C, or D.).<n><n>### Excercice:What are the only 3 remaining choices? (do not check for this. This is an excercise).<n><n>### Annotations:<n>* C. Alaska is the only one outside the USA, meaning that in the case where an apple or other product (fruit or vegetable) from an apple tree in Alaska goes to the USA (through any of its points of entry), the apple will not be an imported product from Alaska, but rather will be an imported product to USA at its point of entry in Alaska.<n>

Choices:  A: violin case B: symphony orchestra C: class D: learning to play violin E: music store<n><n>### Response:		A<n>### Sample<n>### Description<n>You are trying to understand the context, which is a string of sentences.<n>### Guidance<n>1. Review all of the instruction, making sure you understand the intent.<n>2. Break instruction down into steps or stages that you will need to perform in order to complete the task.<n>3. Read a piece of text that is part of your task, but make sure it's in a way that shows the text needs correction. <n>4. Make your response by addressing the task, the text, and the context as a whole. <n>### Resources<n><n>- [How to Read Like a Writer Worksheet](https://englishlanguagepaper.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/How-to-Read-Like-a-Writer-Worksheet.pdf)<n><n>### Example<n>You don't need to read the article, just skim it to get a sense of the context.  1. "She is one of 90 female violinists in the Philadelphia Orchestra, just slightly more than 15% of the orchestra â€” a small fraction compared to the majority that make up the orchestra, but a sizable number." 2. "After she was selected for the position during her third-year auditions in April, Ms. Chu, whose first name is Shannon, felt like she had made history without even knowing it." 3. "By comparison, in 2017, around 65% of new hires in the United States as a whole were women, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, according to the bureau." 4. "In the Philadelphia Orchestra, half of the members who auditioned for open positions this year were women, and the orchestra has not hired a male lead chair violist in the past decade." 5. "At least 1 million women and gender non-conforming people have been employed as musicians for the Philadelphia Orchestra since its founding in 1900, officials said. But the statistics say it is time for a larger change. The number of lead chair violinists, which is about one violinist per season, is only slightly more than 1%."<n>### Guidelines and Grading<n>- You should choose one of the given answer options if it does not need correction.

He knows that it will be a good fit and he has experience, but he doesn't have all the qualifications that they're asking for, so he's worried about what? Choices:  A: acceptance B: rejection C: hope D: less sleep E: employment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A, acceptance<n><n>### Instructions<n>To answer the question, think about what the people who interview you will want to know from the job applicant youâ€™re pretending to be.<n><n>### Solution:<n>A. Acceptance<n><n>### Inputs:<n>If James get the job, he will be happy about.<n><n>### Response<n>If he get the job, he have less sleep, less money (if he doesn't get the job, he still have less sleep, less time with family and more study/homework, but he have more free time).<n><n>### Question:What will change about Jamesâ€™s life if he gets the job?<n><n>### Solution<n>James will be happier and less worried when he get the job.<n><n><n>### Instuction:<n>Write a response that appropriately combines the paragraph.<n><n>### Paragraph:Having a clean house is important, and keeping everything clean is as simple as following three steps. Start with a thorough, end-to-end cleaning. Begin in one area and work until you finish it all. For instance, you would start in the living room or kitchen and work your way through each room, and when you finish, you should do it again, cleaning until the entire house is spotless. Clean one or two things each day until theyâ€™re completed, such as laundry, dishes, or vacuuming. This way, when the family gets home, the first thing you see is a clean house.<n><n>### Example:<n>One way is to sweeps the floor once a day.<n>Once a week clean the bathroom.<n><n>### Examples:<n>Practical steps that can help you keep a house clean<n><n>### Demostration:<n>If the house is clean, he will have confidence. If the house is clean, and he have lots of time.<n><n>### Problem Set Question:Write a response that appropriates combines the paragraphs.<n><n>### Write the first paragraph:<n>Having a clean house, and keeping everything clean, is as simple as following the three steps:  First step: a thorough, end-tot end cleaning. How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. Then, you will answer a math problem, using arithmetic (addition, subtraction, division, or multiplication). The problem will have an equal number of operations (plus or minus).  The operation types will add up to an equal value as the total of the three input numbers (addition/subtraction, addtion/addtion).  For example, 3 is equal to 0 + 3 = 3 is equal to (+) addtion or (-) subtraction.  So, the solution will have three operations in total, and the solution will have an equal number for each operation type.<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input 1: 7,2,9,5,10<n>Input 2: 5,1,3,2,9,4,8<n><n>Input 2:  7,2,9<n>Input 2:    2,9<n><n>### Instuction:<n>Answer the following math problem with the same number of operations as the operations in the first (input) set of problems.<n><n>### Input1:<n>1. The numbers were from sets of questions, but the numbers are all positive.<n>2. The numbers should all be positive and there should not be negative numbers.<n>3. If that doesnâ€™t make sense, the numbers should all be even because the problem requires addition and subtraction.<n>4. Also, in the future there should be one or two numbers, and the operation type should be either addition or subtraction.<n>5. The sum of that operation should equal the sum of the numbers.<n><n>### Response1:<n><n>Answer: Choices: Choice: Choice:

He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: health center B: vagina C: emergency room D: drawer E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Answer:<n>E<n><n>### Answer Explanation:<n><n>The question asks where one might get a contraceptive. The choices are <n>B (vagina), C (emergency room) D (drawer), E (medicine cabinet), and, <n>F(hair salon). The choices are not logical. The vagina is a female biological<n>feature. One would not go to an emergency room for a contraceptive. <n>Drawn is a direction, not a destination. We go to drawers to pull out something. The emergency room is, of course, <n>not a place to get contraceptives. <n>The medicine cabinet may contain tampons, condoms, latex sheaths, foam roll-ons, and, even<n>the sponge. The hair salons may have condoms, birth control foam, tampons and other things.<n>The best choice, in this case is E (medicine chest). We should look in our medicine chest. <n>We might also look in our drawers.<n>

On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:After going for run you have a sense of what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: flying C: sweating D: falling down E: trip<n><n>### Response:		Satisfaction<n><n>

Input : If I want to exercise I should lift __________ time my weight<n><n><n><n><n><n>## 2. Lifting time my weight<n><n>## 3. 1.5 times<n><n>    ANSWER IS 1.5 TIMES<n><n>## 4. 5 TIMES TOO MUCH<n>    if(lift >= 5*12)<n>    answer1=lift*.5   <n>    print(answer1)<n><n>input: Five times the number of Doer man puppies is equal to 92. For example, a queue in a real life can be represented in the stack. The most fundamental operations in the stack are pushing, popping, and accessing.<n><n><n>## 3 Linked List:<n>In a linked list, every element is linked with an element that comes right after it using a pointer.<n><n><n>## Data Flow diagram :<n><n><n>## DFD :<n>- A source represents data input or a process that is started or performed by data output<n>- A sink or a target process is one that results in an output<n>- The data flow arrow represents a direction of data flow or control flow<n>- <n><n>## 4 Binary tree:<n>The tree structure has three or

Your response should be well written and follow the conventions of standard written English.<n><n>### Conventions of Standard Written English<n><n>1. Capitalize the first letter of each new sentence.<n>2. Spell correctly, including proper nouns, pronouns, and verbs.<n>3. Use appropriate punctuation, including capitals at the beginning of sentences, commas, periods, question marks, exclamation points, and quotation marks.<n><n>### Input for Response:<n><n>The request is for a response with words that start with a, b, c, d, or e.<n><n>Your response should begin with a letter from one of the following letters: a, b, c. No other letters may be used at the beginning of a response.<n><n>Your response may be any length.<n><n>Each response may use no more than one letter.<n>No letters may be used twice in a response.<n><n>### Example<n><n>**Response 1**<n><n>B: believe in god<n><n>**Response 2**<n><n>A: expect to die<n>

Which numbers have a sum of 7?<n><n>### Response Instructions:<n>Choose one number and place on the board.<n><n>### Output<n>One out of fifteen.<n><n><n>### Input 2:<n>If I make some 3-inch nails from wire and screw a cap onto them, what am I fixing (or completing? Choices:  a box, bottle, or something else?<n><n>### Input Response:<n>Choice:A box<n><n><n>### Output 2:<n>Every single one of the 140 screw heads will need to be checked for tightness when I am finishing up the final assembly.<n><n>### Example:<n>Shawn, a carpenter, needs to work on a project that involves nails and screws. He needs to complete a total of 47 holes with the 15 screws he needs from the hardware store.  Each screw will need to have a 3-inch length of wire inserted and attached to form the screws. Write a program to help decide what Shawn can do with the wire.<n><n>### Run<n>> node <path/to/syllabus.js> --input<n><n><n>### Result<n>1<n><n>### Instrument:<n>A keyboard for piano.<n><n>### Syllabus.js <n><n>```js<n>const syllabus = new Syllabus();<n><n>;(function() {<n>  const input = syllabus.getInput();<n>  const answer = syllabus<n>   .getAnswer(input)<n>   .map((answer) => answer.join(', '));<n>  <n>  (function

Below is an instruction that describes a task. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		 C, last forever<n><n>### Inputs:<n>* The Reptile House is located by the parking lot and is about the size  of a tennis court.<n>* The Rain Forrest is three times as big as the Reptile House.<n>* The Rain Forest has 16 types of animals, but 8 fewer snakes and lizards than the Reptile House<n><n>### Analysis:<n>In order to work with these statements correctly, we must know the type of question (mathematical, riddle, etc.), number of items, and number of different categories available.<n><n>### Step 1<n>To correctly solve this question, we first need to gather the information given. The given information is listed below.<n><n> - The dimensions of the Reptile House and Rain Forrest.<n> - The animals located in the Reptile House by the number of different animals there.<n> - The general information regarding the different types of animals and their number in each section.<n><n>To note, we will not use the given information in the final answer, as we require only the categories (snakes and lizards, amphibians).<n><n>### Step2<n>So, we start by subtracting the number of snakes and lizard in the Reptile house from the Rain Forrest, which will net the number from which we will calculate.<n><n>Now, we can multiply by 3 to solve the question in a much easier way if we multiply instead of dividing. This ensures we get the correct dimension.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>If we multiply by 3 from both the snakes and lizars, we can see that the Rain Forrest should have snakes and lizas 5 times more than snakes and lizers in the Reptile home. If we deduct that from total animals, we get exactly the correct answer given.<n><n>### Output<n>The final output (a) should be 7.<n><n>## Instructions: In this assessment task, you will be completing the 2nd part of the above task.  In part A the final output was 7.<n><n>In these instructions, you will be required to answer the questions accurately.  <n>To access the task, click on the link given in the Assessment Task menu.<n>

The first iteration is to check whether the number is the root.  For this, we need to find which number is the root, and then we repeat checking it against the numbers.  The second loop is only if the number is root.<n><n>### Code:<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        double answer = 0.0;<n>        double[] numArray = {5, 7};<n>        double sum = 0.0, num1 = 0.0,num2 = 0.0 ;<n>        for (int i = 0;i < numArray.length;i++) {<n>            sum += (numArray[i]);<n>            num1 = numArray[i];<n>            num2 = 1.0 * num1;<n>            if (num2 == sum) {<n>                System.out.println("The result is " +  num1 + " or " + num2);<n>            }<n><n>        }<n><n>    }<n><n>### Instuction: Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Instuctie:<n>In the image, the left one is the original question, and the right one is the right answer. Choices:  A: middle east B: asia minor C: asia D: provide meat E: balkan peninsula<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input: In order to find an answer to your question, we will start with one basic assumption.<n><n>### Response to:<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Input:{1} The number of years is in my past.{2} The number of years the question asks is in the past.<n>Input:{1} the number of years to come.{2} the number of years in the future.<n><n>### Other Direction<n>Input: What comes just before the number 6?<n> Answer: 1<n><n>Input: Find the least number of the 1, 2, 7, and 8 whose square is greater than 3 times the sum of its digits.<n>Answer: 1<n><n>Comment: Welcome to Code Review!! This could be considered fair, if the question said so, but just a hint for the future when you are requesting tasks to do.<n><n>I don't have time to give you a detailed answer. You then go on to complete the request, and you seem to be doing a pretty good job of it.<n><n>I would suggest that when you write your "response" to the request, consider the instruction section separately, and consider the question separately

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n>Select E if they are found in zoological gardens. Select B if they are found in rainforest. Select F if they are found in tree tops. Select D if they are found in great outdoors. Select C if they are found in zoo.<n><n>

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:He needed to check an electrical connection in the house, where did he look? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Jan went to the auditorium and listened to the speech. Where might he be? How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where do you go to meet a friend who lives close to you? Choices:  A: workplace B: bus station C: social atmosphere D: neighbor's house E: at school<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: Option A: workplace, workplace, workplace<n><n>### Response(Explanation):<n>In a social atmosphere, the answer will always be that they will go to their friend's house.<n><n><n>### Input and Output<n>If a friend invites you to go for jogging. Your first question is â€œwhat time will be the time, and we will meet there?â€. The friend will say answer as,<n><n>The first half of the distance will take the exact time. In the last half of the time distance, you will complete the journey in lesser time.<n><n>If your friend asks the time in the next morning, how you will answer?<n><n>Answer: Option B: social atmosphere<n><n>### Response<n>The second time the friend invites you to jogging, you will go. When you are done jogging, the distance is halfway done. <n><n>### Input<n>You receive three gifts from your friends. The first gift you receive is three times greater than the second gift and half as much as the first one. The third gift, is equal to the first gift.<n><n>Your first question is, â€œHow much is each gift?â€<n><n>Answer: Option E: at school<n>

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n><n>### Response:		<n>![Answer with an Image](Images/image66.png)<n><n>### Explanation:<n>![Clarification and Explanation](Clarifications/Clarification66.png)

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		D (might dream)<n><n>---<n><n>### How many times does 8 go into 53? Show your steps.<n><n>### Input<n><n>8, 53, division<n><n>### Response<n><n>Eight goes into 53 eight times; it cannot go into the number 53 any other number of times.<n><n>---<n><n>When you are cooking, you can add more water than is listed to a liquid recipe. When you find a good recipe, you will know the quantity of liquid needed to make it. You can easily find a good recipe by reading the description and knowing how many people will eat it at one time.<n><n>### Problem: You are not sure how many applesauce cups you should buy for dinner for 7 people.<n>Input: 25 cups<n>7 cups is the right amount.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

If she has 8 eggs in total, what are her three-color eggs?<n><n>### Choices:<n>A: blue<n>B: yellow<n>C: white<n>D: green<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Molly has 8 eggs in all. She has four blue eggs, so four left to find the answer. She has three yellow eggs, so she has 5 left to find the answer, and she has two of one color of egg so she has 7 left to find the answer of those eggs, and 2 blue, 3 yellow, 2 of one color makes one out of the total 8 eggs.<n><n>### Correct:<n>C<n><n>### Choci 2<n><n>## Instruction:<n>The price to fill your gas tank is directly proportional to the number of gallons of gas that's in it. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. Students will explore the production process and the role it plays in society. Course content will include an extensive introduction to the terminology, principles, and practices of manufacturing.<n><n>* Identify and name the basic components of a machine and how each functions in conjunction with all the other components.<n>* Distinguish among the various processes used to manufacture a product.<n><n>* Explain how the production cycle begins, using the example of the production of a bicycle.<n><n>###

How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? Choices:  "It went well" "It rained" "Well, it wasn't raining" "I'm sure it went well. " "Sally's birthday?"<n><n>###Response: "It went well."<n><n>###Instruct: The population of a city is growing at a steady rate. Ten years ago, there were three times as many males as females. Now, there are still three times as many males. If the population had grown by two million, would this rate of growth still be true? If the population had increased by ten million, would the rate of growth still be the same? Use the rule of three to answer the question.<n><n>## Instruction Answer: "Yes, the rate of growth would still be the same. If the population had increased tenfold, the rate of growth remained the same. The reason for this is because when we increased the population by ten million, the rate of growth remains unchanged because it remains equal to the ratio of the males to females."<n><n>## # # Instruction: An investor has $10,000 and he wants to know what the amount is in 10 years. He believes that the interest will be compounded daily instead of monthly. His calculations are 17% daily compounded for a 10 year period. His calculations are as follows: (10k * (1+17/100) ^ 365) = 1.01500. So he gets $1.015 * 10k = 10 * 1.01334 * 10k is $

Show your work where appropriate or needed.<n><n>#### Task3<n><n>Writeto the instructor by clicking the submit button below.<n>\end{code}<n><n>Answer: You need to remove the curly braces from most instances of the `write to the instructor` function.<n><n>\strong{Example}<n><n>\begin{code}<n># Instructions:Answer the following multiple...<n>write to the instructor<n><n>[instruction]<n>Write a response that appropriately...<n>\end{code}(no curly braces)<n><n>Also, remove the curly brace in [Instructions:](https://chat.stackoverflow.com/transcript/message/20296437#20296527).<n><n>Comment: Thank you for this. I get no errors upon running this but it just doesn't read the question. How can I get it to read the questions?<n><n>Comment: It doesnt read the questions because of the line with `Write a response that appropriatley...`<n><n>Comment: Thank for the clarification. So the problem is there to not the questions?<n><n>Answer: Instead of having multiple functions to write to the instructor, you should just have \em{one}, then just have a parameter that can be used to differentiate the input from the command to write to the instructors.<n><n>Another thing is I see you are using 2 different `read` functions, I don't recommend that as it makes things unnecessarily complicated.<n><n>Here it is with some improvements (read it all and you will see):<n><n>\begin{blockquote}<n><n>\begin{[instruction] Write the correct answer in a<n>\end{blockquote}<n><n>This instruction is too similar to 2 other sentences that occur in the task, so I recommend changing it to something different, something like "Write the correct answer to the question below".<n><n>\begin{pre}<n><n>```<n># Instructions<n>### Question1<n><n>Write the correct answer to  the question below

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>The problem that needs to be solved is to answer the question of what noise a human makes when going to sleep. There are two steps in the solution. The first is to determine the possible answers. These can be represented in a _table, which is a chart that shows data in rows and columns_. The second step is to make a decision about the answer based on the data in the table. This step could be represented in a _decision tree, which is a flow chart showing decision points and the resulting paths._<n><n>The data can be represented on the table below.<n><n>| Answer choice | No. of human beings heard at bedtime | No. of human being heard in daytime |<n>|-|-|-|<n>|A|0|2|<n>|B|2|6|<n>|C|3|3|<n>|D|4|4|<n>|E|5|1|<n><n>### Solution:<n>This problem provides a list of five answer choices. It should be determined which of these is the correct answer.<n><n>It can be determined that answer choices B, C, and E are incorrect because the number of human beings observed in the evening time does not match the listed numbers for the corresponding answers. Answer choice A is also incorrect because there is no noise observed.<n><n>This leaves answer choices B and C. From the table, it can be seen that _when the same number of human beings are observed in the evening and daytime, it is because these human beings are snoring._ Therefore, answer choice B is chosen because it matches the data in the table and is the correct answer to the question posed in the problem.
