How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The man needed flooring, where was he looking to install it? Choices:  A: loft B: home depot C: house D: tiles E: carpet store<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A,B,C,D,E Floor tiles<n><n>### Input, Multiple Choice: In April, it rains an average of 76 mm more than in June. You then need to choose either "yes, this is true" or "no, my answer is not in those options".*<n><n>### How to create your task<n><n>![](https://github.com/BurakGunduz/MotivateIT/blob/main/Motivate.IT/Exercise12/Images/QuestionImage.jpg)<n><n>### What is the goal of these tasks?<n><n>In this task you will be learning about<n><n>- Creating & answering multiple choice quiz questions<n>- Answering multiple choice quiz questions correctly<n>- Explain the answer of the question<n>- Find out the right answer for the question<n><n>### How the tasks will be marked?<n>  If you answered the question correctly, you will have chosen a "yes answer".<n><n>  If you answered incorrectly, you will have chosen "no" instead of "yes" answer.<n>

Choices:  A: problems B: crying C: inspiration D: trauma E: nightmares<n><n>### Response:		E<n>### Correct:<n>If you have succeeded in something once, you will more likely be able to continue the success you have had.<n><n>### Wrong:<n>You are more likely to fail or have problems when you remember past successes.<n><n>### Input:- The cashier takes half of any price, leaving the customer with twice the original price. The customer then takes half of that price, leaving the cashier with four times the original price. What happens when the customer gets the cashier's price?<n> -If the price was $6, the new price would be 24 cents.<n><n>### Response:-<n>### Correct: <n>$2 is twice as much as 1 so, when the cashier gives you twice the original price, you take half that price and the cashier takes half your half, bringing 4 times the original price.<n><n>### Correct answer: 16<n>### Instruction:-The first year we won the Division II Championship, I played defense for the second half of the season. Ice fishing on Lake Superior is regulated by Michigan DNR Natural Resources, Environment, and Great Lakes Division, Parks and Recreation Division. The Michigan DNR web site provides information on winter activities including ice fishing on Lake Superiors, in addition to information related to ice travel safety.<n><n>Note:The information provided in the input matches the answer provided. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:If there is a stale smell in the air coming from the kitchen, what should one check for the source of the smell? Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		Input: Dr. Banks has a lot of patients and he had a lot of cleaning to do. You are given the following information about the numbers. One of them is 304. The sum of all the numbers is 310.  What is the number closest to 172?<n><n>### Input 1: In the questions about sets, you have information about the order of operations, but not a single operation. Given the four operations, four of them, at least three of them, or two of them have no effect on the order of a set of numbers.<n><n>### Response 1: One or two of the operations have no effect on the number.<n><n>### Example:Let's look at each operation.  Subtraction can't flip positive and negative numbers.  Division changes the sign of both the dividend and divisor, adding -1 to both.   Powers of 2 don't affect the set, since powers of 2 multiply the numbers on the right.  Exponents are based on the number squared, so no effect, and the number in the exponent goes down by a half.  Exponents are only taken if their base is positive and at least 1, so that leaves multiplication as the only case where changing the order of operations of a set might matter, but if multiplying two numbers then you take powers no less than one on each side:<n><n>### Conclusion:In this example, only multiplication and exponents are taken.<n><n>### Suggested Solution:<n>

Choices:  A: eat grass B: play C: kept in stables D: dominated E: drink coffee<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n><br/>The following is my thought process:<n><n>#### Input:<n>* 1:E (Energy)<n>* 2:A (grass)<n>* 3:A (grass again)<n>* 4:D (Doctor)<n>* 5:A (Grass again)<n><n>#### My Thought Process:<n>(Input) *(6) Which choice do we need to remove or remove (and have the question be valid again)<n>B<n><n>### Input-Write each answer on a separate line:Demonstrate the task.<n><n>### Response<n><n><br/><n><n>### How Do I<n><n><center><img src="img\howdowait_03.png" align="center"><n><n><br/><br/><n>You need to show that you understand how to write code in order to complete this task:<n><n>Create the required functions and data type definitions yourself.<n><n>### Input<n>Each function and data type definition that you are demonstrating must have the same name as the function and data type definition in the instructions.<n><n>* write a function, `greeting` that takes no arguments and returns a greeting.<n>* write a function `greeting`that takes one argument of type `String` and return the greeting<n>* write a function that takes no argument and returns a data type `String`, `A`, that represents information about the number of members in a family (number of family members, name and age), the number is in the format `int, int, String`.<n>* write a function called `age_format` that takes a data type argument `A` of type `String` that format the number of years between the user's birthdate and the current date.<n>* A data type definition of type `B` that consists of the information of any given name, birthdate and age.<n><n><br/>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:There are a lot of ways to relax, for this person it is simply opening one up and what? Choices:  A: more rice B: own house C: warm coat D: light up E: read book<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### Input:Write a response that appropriately answers that question.<n><n>## Output:<n>```<n>Input: It rains 2 inches more than Friday rained every day that week. How much rain fell over the 5 days?<n><n>Answer: 6<n>```<n><n>### Instrument:Cli<n><n>### Output:<n>```<n><cldr><n>	<unit name="cm"><n>		<factor>100</factor><n>		<dimensions><n>			<length>true</length><n>		</dimensions><n>	</unit><n>	<unitName unitId="pt">pt</unitName><n></cldr><n>```<n><n># Example<n><n><pre><n>$ cli -i 01d.pdf<n>Output:C<n>Output:A<n>Output:D<n>Output:E<n>Output:B<n>Output:C<n></pre><n>

If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:How would someone feel after going for run? Choices:  A: working out B: sore C: get tired D: satisfaction E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### The process:<n><n>    Read the question to the user, and then ask the user how the person feels.<n>    <n>- After reading the task to the user and then asking the user to choose an option, ask them again to see what option they chose.<n>- If their answer is B, C, or D, ask them again for clarification, either by telling them which choices to select or by removing one of the choices from the question (adding 1 and 2, or removing E), and then asking them to select one of those options again.<n>For example: after reading the instruction the first time you could ask them "How does the person feel?" <n>And after they say "sore" you could ask "How sore does he feel?" <n>And if they choose "Extremely sore, and ready to quit" you can ask them "How does he feel now?"<n>- If they chose a different option, just move on to the next question.<n>For example: you had asked "How does the person not feel?" and after they chose B, you could ask them "Why isn't he working out?"<n>- When they have correctly answered all questions and you have a number, print that number to the console.<n>- Once they have selected D, give them their score.<n><n>### The Process:<n>1. Read the question to the User, if they respond "I quit" then print "You quit"<n>2. Otherwise print "What are choices?"<n>3. Read all 5 options out load, if the user responds with a number respond with a message that you do not understand their response, and ask them to pick a different option, if they do not answer, move on asking the user how they feel.<n>4. If the user does not answer, read out load all 5 options and if you get a message from them, respond with the same number you saw, if they chose a different number, ask them to type the number again.<n>5. Once the user types in the correct answer move on to the next process.<n><n>---<n><n>### Input Question:What is 0 divided by 0?<n><n>### Answer:  <n>0/0 can't be divided, this is called a _NaN_ (Not a Number)<n><n>### Input Answer:7<n><n>### Response Answer:  <n>Wrong<n>---<n><n>

How long will the shadows be 6 hours after noon?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>## Solution description:<n><n>### Step 1: Describe the situation<n>Give a response to the user that introduces the story problem.<n>**Step 2: Clarifying Question**. How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday. B<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>Choose the choice that most likely will satisfy the request.<n><n>a.<n>Write a program that is able to determine the height of a person.<n>b.<n>Write a program able to determine the weight of a person.<n>c.<n>Write a program to subtract a person's height from 6 feet.<n>d.<n>Write a program  to use a variable to store the height of a person<n>e.<n>Write a program with three variables the height is one of them<n><n>### Response Choices:<n>Answer the question in the manner the author indicates.<n><n>a. The height of a person will be the answer that will be determined.<n><n>        public static double getHeight(double[] heights) {<n><n>            double total = 0,height=0;<n><n>            for (double i = 0; i < heights.length; i++) {<n><n>                heights[i];<n>                total = total + heights[i];       //  the height of a person = the answer will be determined<n>            }<n>            return total;<n>        }<n>b. Choices:  A: like more B: nodding C: by wearing rings D: concordance E: shake hands<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>```<n>$ python sample1.py<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a program that takes 3 inputs like below:<n>Input: Every hour after 10:00 am, the sun moves 3 degrees north in the sky.<n>Input: Every hour, the sun rises 3 degrees north.<n>Input: The sun sets east.<n>You should output the following:<n>Day: 1,  Sun: SE,  Latest setting: 3:00<n>Day: 2,  Sun: SSE,  Latest setting; 4:00<n>Day 3,  Sun: S,  Latest setting, 5:00 etc.<n><n>### Input Format:<n>Each input line contains 3 or 4 space delimited floating-point numbers: the number of days since midnight, the latest setting, and the latitude. Latitude is between -100 and 100 and corresponds to the hour of the sun at its highest, starting at the end of the night on the first line and ending at the end of the day on the last line. The latitude of the sun setting at 10:05:30 pm is 70.<n><n>### Output Format:<n>On each line, print one integer, the number of the day. This number will be from 1 to 16. On each subsequent line, you will print one more line: the sky position, the latest setting and the latitude. Print in the form Day: Latitude: Sky position eg 'Day 1:SE:90'. The sky position is formed from three separate words followed by a comma. If the sun is on the horizon, the third word is ''rising''. If the sky is overcast, the third word is empty (e.g., 'E:90').

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The print was extremely small, as he was reading letter after letter he began to suffer eye what? Choices:  A: strain B: though C: happiness D: realization E: understanding<n><n>### Response:		Realization<n><n>

Choices:  A: grand casino B: large room C: restaurant D: country club E: lobby<n><n>### Response:		A grand casino is the place for you! If your reception is inside a grand casino there will be a lot of people there. The large room is a great place if you are not expecting a large number of guests. If your reception is at a restaurant the space will be limited. The large room, the large room and the country club would only work for your reception if there were a few guests attending. If you take your reception out on the lobby you will probably only be greeted by one guest.<n><n>### Input If you find the product of two numbers is even, what is the sum of the numbers. Choices A: 1 B: 2 C: 3 D: 4 E: 5<n><n>### Response In the question, we are given that the product of two numbers times even is even. This tells us that our numbers we are subtracting are not opposites. When subtracting two numbers, and we subtract numbers that are opposite as in numbers divisible by 2, then the result is always divisible by 2. So we must have that the order of the two numbers would be for example 19, 14 and 5 in which the product of the numbers is 76 which is even. So the two numbers are either 19, 5 or 14.<n><n>### Question: If it takes three-quarter of an hour for me to walk 20 meters, how long will it take me to walk 10 kilometers? Choices A: 2 hours and 50 minutes B: 2 hours and a half C: 4 hours and fifty minutes D: 4 hours E: Two hours<n><n>### Question answer It takes three-quarter an hour for me to walks 20  meter which would mean that I walk 2 kilometers. So to walks 10 kilimeters would be 20KM. 2KM / 3quarters of an hour = 20 KM / 3quarters. Choose the solution based on the condition:<n><n>### In the solution if at least one element is an odd number<n><n>### Then the sum of all the odd elements is an odd number<n>In the solution if at least all even elements are even<n><n>### Then at least one odd number is included in the sum of the even numbers<n><n>### Then if the sum is even<n><n>### When at least one odd number has at least as small a value as at least one even number<n><n>### The size of the solution is between 10 and 15 inclusive.<n><n>### Solution: [The output is a two digit integer in the range 10 to 15 inclusive indicating the array size]<n>### Demonstraion: the sum of the elements is an odd number.<n>### Demonstaion: the sum of all even elements is an even number, meaning that at least 1 odd number has to be in the solution.<n>### Demostration: if the size is less than 10, then one or zero elements are odd, then it is not an odd number and is not part of the solution. The same for even is true.<n>### Demonautation: If it is 10, no odd number can be part of the solution, but one odd number can be part if the solution and will be if the even number is at least 2 (if there are 0 odd then no even can be part of the 10, if it is 1 even and 0 odd both can not be part of the even number unless there are 1 odd, there are 1 even, and the even even cannot be part of the solution) if the even number is even that is not part of the odd so it can be part of the whole solution. If it is in a 10 to 90 range, it must have even at least is 2 (if no odds it must either have 0 even or exactly 2 even), either one. If it the sum of all

Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		<n>### If the fruit market is just for grapes, put the grapes in the fruit market.<n>### When that's clear, put the grapese in the super market.<n>### If they're not just for grapes put them in the fruit market.  <n>### Otherwise, if the customer has the fruit basket that they get when checking out and there is no fruit market, put the grapesse in that basket.  <n>If the basket is not there, put them in the fruit markst.<n><n>### Note: The grapes always must end up some where.<n><n>### Input<n>-  Where do you put your gripes just before checking out?<n>-  A: Mouth<n>-  B: Grocery Cart<n>-  C: Super Market<n>-  D: Fruit Basket<n>-  E: Fruit market<n><n>### Correct Answer<n>- <n><n>## Submission<n><n><section id="solution-id"><n>  <p id="solution-p"><n>    <div id="solution-container"><n>      <h2 id="solution-h">Instructions</h2><n>      <div>Example 1</div><n>      <ol><n>        <li><n>          <p>Input: Five less than the number of Dobermans is the number of Schnazers. A: an employee permit B: a cash register C: skills D: a good eye E: A, B and C <n><n>## Answer<n>D<n><n>## Justification:<n>In order to work in a cafÃ©, you will need to know how to operate the machine, which involves taking in cash and handing out proper change. This will require you to keep both an eye for detail and the ability to process things accurately under time pressure.<n><n>## Input Question #10 Input: What would you do if you don't have any money? A: apply for job  B: stand in line   C: take care of proposal D: pass course E take out a loan<n><n>##Answer: 	C<n><n>##Justification:<n><n>To get money, the most effective way is taking care of proposal.<n><n>##Input Question 11 Input: What are the three important reasons for buying in advance the food supply to cope with heavy rainy season?<n><n>##Answer:<n><n>The three important reasons for buing in advance the food supply are as follows:<n><n>1. It is to avoid hunger.<n><n>In case of heavy rainy season, the supply of food can't be sufficient as it is transported by the road. Therefore, people should buy the necessary food before the rainy season so as not to starve to death, which is important reason for buying in advance;<n><n>2. It is to save money<n>Buying products in advance, we only have to pay a single bill because we would not have to pay a single price for each item that we buy, it will help us to save money.<n><n>3. It is to enjoy the product<n>If there are more than one type and variety of products, we could choose to buy the favorite.<n><n>Because buying in advance, there would be no rush and we wouldn't have to fight for buying a good product. So, it helps us to save time and enjoy the good quality products.<n><n>Those are 3  reasons that to buy in advance necessary food to cope with rain season.<n><n>## Input

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:James felt himself losing consciousness.  He was frightened.  He didn't want this.  He was scared of what? Choices:  A: death B: coma C: peace D: forgetfulness E: loss of life<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions for answer the below multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Answers: <n>* A: death <n>* B: coma <n>* C: peace <n>* D: forgetfulness<n>* E: loss of life <n><n>### Instagram Challenge<n>This problem requires you to use your Instagram account to follow at least 3 people. 1434167 is the 68 digit long randomized number, where each digit is the number of followers of one person.  You might need to change the number of people or the number of digits to use this example for learning.<n><n>Write a program to retrieve the first 4 digits of the number. For example,  3561 is the solution for 68 because 3561 is > 68 when the first digit at any position is greater than the digit at the same position in 68.  <n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. Choice: C<n><n>### Demo:<n><p><n>A letter is a form of written communication where the sender and receiver do not interact with each other during the exchange.<br/><n>The writer of the letter can either be referred to as the sender, or the letter writer. <br/><n>A letter can be hand written, typed or printed.<n></p><n><n>### Example<n><p><n>To whom it may concern, <br/><n><n>My name is Kyle and I will be attending your school. <br/> <br/> I am looking forward to this new adventure. <br/> <Br/> You're the best. <br/> <p>Your Favorite Teacher<n></p><n>Kyle<n><n></p><n>

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		 D

How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What would children do if they are bored? Choices:  A: walk B: change shoes C: play tag D: smell smoke E: reach over<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: What would children do if they were bored?<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input: Dr Pepper needs help finding a new intern this summer. This semester she's asked Sally, Steve, Tim, and Zach to take a 4-hour test to see if they'll be able to work with her. The tests will include: 1) taking a calculus final exam, 2) answering one of the SAT test questions, 3) finding and correcting the 32 spelling errors in the SAT word list, 4) figuring out how much 24 grams of yeast is in tbsp and 5) identifying the 7 cones on a 3D model of an Earthquake damage model. Let x represent the number of students who will pass the test and can work with Dr Pepper.  <n><n>If one student is randomly selected and the probability that that student passes the test is 0.8, what does Dr Pepper's mean is 1/2?<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>**A.** Input: Dr Pepper needs assistance finding a summer intern. She's gone through 4 semesters of testing and has gathered only 1 variable from previous semesters.  <n><n>x: number of students who have passed a certain test  <n><n>**B.** A semester's worth of data has been collected:<n><n>**What is the sample mean**<n>**What is the standard deviation?**<n>**What is 95% of that standard deviation?**<n><n>**B. What is 97.5% of that standard deviatioon?**<n><n>**c. Is the data normally distributed?**<n><n>**D. What 24-hour contingency plan does a company have?**<n><n>-A: Testing on the 9's for 12 hours if there is a data breach<n>-B: Training employees to do 15 scenarios in 45 minutes at any time<n>-C: No training<n><n>**When we conduct a 100% contingency plan at midnight and the results come back at 8am the next day, we are conducting which _______?**<n><n>**A: A 24-hour plan by running every scenario for 12 hours

How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Ann bought 15 pounds of beans while Jim bought twice as much.<n>How many pounds of beans did Jim buy?"<n><n>### Demination:<n><n><n>```js<n>//Input:<n>'Ann can buy 1/5 times as many beams as can Jim.<n>  One afternoon on Wednesday Ann and Jim, went shopping at Food Mart. Ann bought  5 pounds of beams while Jim bought twice as many.     <n>  How many pounds of beams did Jim buy?'<n>//Input and Solution:<n>const solve = (input) => {<n>  let ans<n><n>let arr = parseFloat(input)<n>let result = 0<n><n>for(let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {<n><n>ans = arr[i] * (1 / 5);<n>result += ans<n><n>}<n>console.log(ans)<n>console.log(result)<n>}<n><n>solve("Ann can buy ðŸ«£ 1/5 times ðŸ«£ as many beams as ðŸ«£ can Jim. One afternoon on Wednesy ðŸ«£ Ann and Jim went ðŸ«£ shopping at Food Mart, ðŸ«£ Anna, ðŸ«§ picked ðŸ«£ up ðŸ§ª five pounds of beams ðŸªŸ while Jim ðŸ‘ ðŸ‘ picked up twice â€†â€†â€as many."<n>  )<n>```<n>- Solution Explanation:<n>    1. Initializing an empty string<n><n>  let ans  = ""<n>  ans += ""<n><n>```<n>    for(let i = 1; i < input.lenth; i++) {<n>        ans += input[i]<n><n>    }<n>  console.log(ans)  <n>```<n>    <n>### Demonition:<n>```js<n>//solution:<n>```<n>

How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. I love being at  the shore.'<n><n>### Response:'You are standing with your arms uncrossed at a sandy beach.'<n><n>### Comment:<n><n>I see a problem, if I am uncrossing my arms, my posture makes me assume and stand like the answer provided from me `You are standing with your left arm cross-like at a cold beach`. If I want to stand at a cold beach, I won't cross either arm. If I am at a hot beach, I might cross both arms on my chest to avoid my shoulders from perspiring with the heat.<n>But it seems like my posture is always cross-like? The only time I have crossed arms to me is `like a girl` as per our American/Canadian culture. So I can stand with my arms crossed if I am standing like a girl and if I want to avoid my shoulders from sweating, I don't cross my arms.<n><n>### Fix:<n><n>If I am to describe the posture of the girl, I will say:<n>I am standing with my arms crossed like a girl.<n><n>If I want the person to stand like a man, I will say: <n>I am standing with your arms on your chest.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>>*Clean your house* to *Chew your gum*<n>><n><n>### Meanings:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>>*Clean my house* to *Cheetah gum*<n><n>### Response #1<n>>*Clean mug* to *Chewed gum*<n><n>Giving meaning of the 1st instruction of the example, I was instructed to clean *my* house. This means that the virus can only reproduce (infect and reproduce at the same time). If I'm going to give this question to a person, I'll add "make computer malfunction". You do not have to answer to this question.<n><n>## Answer:<n>A,D<n>### Discussion:<n>#### Input:Dr. Banks had 400 toothbrush to give away to his poor patients. He gave away more toothbrush in March than April. Dr. Banks had twice as many toothbrush as he gave away in June.  How many toothbrushes have been given away from January to June?<n>In January 4 toothbrushes were given away.  So Dr. Banks have 400 - 4 =404 <n><n>In February 24 toothbrushs are given away.  So 404 - 24 = 380<n><n>In March 48 are given away.  so 380 - 48 = 332 <n><n>In April 32 are given away.  But because of our restriction, it is impossible to subtract 48 from 394 or 394 - 32, so lets use 394 -382 = 12<n><n>In may 21 are given away.  but again, 12 cannot be subtracted with 404 so lets use 404 -383 =11<n><n>In June 19 toothbrushs were given away. So 404-11- 19 = 374<n><n>### InputS: Dr. Banks, the owner of the Dental Clinique, had 100 toothbristles. His assistant, Mr. Bean, used 60 in a dental cleaning. The doctor also used 40 toothbrush. If they used 100 tootbrushbristles, what was the remainder?<n>Dr. Banks has 300 toiletbristles - 70 bristles are used by the assistant, 70 bristeles are used by the doctor.

He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? Choices:  A: fly B: milk cows C: eat D: answering questions E: fail to work<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions

Choices:  A: living B: feeling good C: hyperventilate D: look around E: breathe deeply<n><n>### Response:		Option B - feeling good<n><n>### Input - In order:<n>> First line: 47.<n>> Second line: -21.<n>> Third line: 60.<n>> Fourth line: Diff: 134.<n>> Fifth line: 14.<n>> Sixth line: E.<n><n>### Response<n>```c<n>#include <stdio.h><n>int main() {<n>    int first_line;<n>    int second_line;<n>    long int diff_line;<n>    double result;<n><n>    double number_1, number_2;<n>    scanf("%d %d %lli %lf", &first_line, &second_line, &diff_line, &result);<n><n>    printf("The difference between first line and second line it's %lli\n", diff_line);<n>    printf("The result of difference between first line and the second line is %lf\n", result);<n><n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>```c<n>120<n>54<n>5400<n>110<n>40<n>650<n>95959050<n>121.5<n>5<n>3<n>1<n>52<n>5<n>40<n>8<n>```<n><n>## Task description<n>

She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where would a ficus plant brighten up a room? Choices:  A: middle east B: palace C: dictionary D: pots E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		Choice: B<n><n>### Instructions:Input:On every day of school, students from 5th and 6th grade get math drills to do. If on one day 1/4 of the 5th grade students did the drills, and on that day 3/5 of the 6th graders did the drills, how many sixth graders did drills that day?<n><n>### Response 1:Choice: C<n>### Reason: The 5th grade student population is 40%.  Therefore, the 5th grade drills were done by 40% of the students<n><n>### Rationale:5th grade student population, n = 40% = 0.40<n>5th grade student who did drills, n = 0.4/0.4 = 1/4<n>6th grade student who did math drills, n = (0.6)/(0.6)/5 = 3/5<n>Rationale:5th grade did not do drills<n><n>### Response to 1st response:Choice: B<n>

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where would a ticket help you to get to a different country? Choices:  A: train station B: baseball stadium C: lottery D: movie E: bus<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>### InputHow should you dress for a cold climate? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. The outputs are always incorrect if they are not 0 and incorrect when they are not what is called for.

Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Write a paragraph that describes the task below.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>In response to the following prompt, describe in 100 to 150 words the role of a journalist in creating awareness to the people, and the responsibility of a citizen in being informed and responsible.<n><n>The journalism profession is a crucial link that brings information and awareness to the public. Although many people believe that all journalists are biased no matter what they write, it is true that some journalists are better equipped to make a difference in the way that they do it. Through their writings and photographs, journalists help to make people aware of the things that are happening around them on a daily basis. With the constant availability and dissemination of information, the world in which we live today is a much safer place than ever before because the public is not left in the dark about the important issues. As citizens, we must read, listen, and watch the news daily in order to be informed and to make the best decisions.<n><n><n>### Input and Output:<n>You should review the following statements in the table below. Then, write a response to each statement.<n><n>| Statement | Input | Output|<n>|-:|-:|-|<n>| Write a paragraph that describes the role of a writer in creating awareness about the environment. |The writer is an individual responsible for providing information about environmental issues, such as global warming. | The writer is responsible for providing information about the environmental issues. It is the writer's responsibility to be aware of the environmental issues. The writer's role is to create awareness and responsibility in the public. |The writer is the one who creates awareness of the environmental issues. |<n>| Write a paragraph explaining the role of a newspaper in creating awareness of environmental issues. |A newspaper is a publication that publishes articles and advertisements in print. | | The newspaper is the source from which the public gets information about the environmental issues, |<n>| Write a sentence to the reader informing them of the importance of newspaper reading and newspaper advertising. |The importance of newspaper reading is to get the most up-to-date information about the current events, as well as to find out what is happening around them. Newspapers provide articles and advertisements for free to the public. |

Choices:  A: republican party B: old people's home C: office D: park E: high school or college<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input Two words in the order given<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The instructions for this problem are:<n>If the word "apple" is written 9 times, "bear" is written 5 times, and "elephant" is written 7 times, which has fewer letters: "apple bear elephant" or "bear apple elephant"?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer this question. You can use either the mathematical or the programmatic approach to solve the task.<n><n>### Task:<n>Each of the following sentences has two words. In one of the sentences, the words are in the order given. In the other sentence, they are in the reverse order. Identify the sentence in which the two words are in the correct order.<n><n>### Example Instruction:<n>The word list given in the instruction consists of two words, but in the order they appear. In the solution response, one of those words is written again in the order it appears. The other word is written in a new order that is not in the sentence list.<n><n>### Incorrect Response: apple bear elephant<n><n>### Correct Response: bear apple elephant<n><n>The following sentence demonstration shows the solution: If the word "apple" was written ___ times, "bear' would be written __ times, and "elef" would be written __ times in the order it appears in the sentence word list, which has fewer letters than the sentence with words written in different order?<n><n>### Solve Task:<n>In the example solution word list, the two words are the same as they are in the sentence. In the example solution sentence, one of the words is the same and was rearranged from the sentence list, and the other is different from the sentence list and can be rearranged into multiple different orders.

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? Choices:  A: grocery store B: grocery bag C: restaurants D: farmer's market E: bushel basket<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question given.<n>

Choices: A: skyline B: rooftop C: sky D: horizon E: cloud<n><n>### Response:: If you are visiting a certain city you can visit the tallest building.<n><n><n>### Input:/ Two friends walk along a beach. The first friend sees a piece of litter and throws it away. The second friend sees the litter next to the other friend on the beach and assumes that the first friend is lazy and never picks up the litter because it's never there. Afterward, the second friend thinks: Hey, I never knew that the first friend was so lazy and sloppy! I guess if they were lazy and sloppy they wouldn't pick up their own litter! What's the minimum number of items that need to be dropped so that one friend can think the other is lazy and sloppy, and both friend's assumptions can be simultaneously valid? Choices:\ A: 5 B: 4 C: 3 D: 2 E: 1<n><n>### Response:/ In this scenario if there were only 2 items then neither friend would think that the other was sloppy. In order for the second friend to think that the first friend is sloppy they must be there at the same time which means they would have to find at least 3 items.<n><n>### Answer<n><n><n>

How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where in your entrance hall can you keep you head wear? Choices:  A: school B: large home C: house D: hat rack E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n>**A**

She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:Input:<n><n>### Response :C<n><n><n>

How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. The wheels make the car go by driving in a circle.  The circle is turned into a line and then the car goes forward.  The car is the line," answered Jake."What can you say about circles in addition to what you know about driving in a circle?" asked Sarah."You can describe a circle using a graph.  The x-and y-axis intersect at the center of the circle.   Circles have radius.  Half the radius describes a semicircle," replied Jake.<n><n>### Input""Fish swim in the water," answered Michael, when asked what  water is for.  "What does water help fish do?" asked Sarah."Water gives fish and other animals something to walk or swim on.  A walk on water would be easy; you would just have to use your hands and feet to move up and down.  If you just stood in the water, then you are still walking and swimming, since you use your hands and feet for that."<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the questions that follow.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>### Response 2:<n>### Response Answer:<n><n>### Demosation # 1<n>### Demostation # 2<n><n>### Instuctions: Answer the following questions

If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:James looked for a pencil sharpener.  Where might he look first? Choices:  A: cabinet B: library C: nightstand D: stationery store E: desk drawer<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following question using the options provided below.<n><n>### Input<n>Write 5 words to answer the question below that contain every letter of the alphabet.<n><n>Letter Frequency<n>A = 3%<n>B = 4%<n>C = 8%<n>D = 6%<n>E = 14%<n>F = 2%<n>G = 2%<n>H = 4%<n>I = 11%<n>J = 1%<n>K = 3%<n>L = 5%<n>M = 6%<n>N = 5%<n>O = 4%<n>P = 2%<n>Q = 9%<n>R = 7%<n>S = 2%<n>T = 5%<n>U = 2%<n>V = 1%<n>W = 3%<n>X = 2%<n>Y = 2%<n>Z = 3%<n><n>### Response<n>5 words would be:<n>ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTVWXY<n><n>### Output:<n>Here are the choices, in order, from most to least correct. Choose one.<n><n>The answer is X<n><n>### Instructios:<n>Invest 252 dollars and 85 cents in bonds.  Each of nine bonds is worth 94 dollars and 30 cents.  How much does each bond cost?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Each bond will cost $9.43. We can solve problems like this by dividing up the whole amount we have so that each bond would cost $9.42. Since the whole amount we have is $252.85, this would require us to divide up the $252.00 by 9.  Using basic algebra, we would multiply $252 by $1/9 and we get $27.76.  This is $1.20 more than we need in order to cover the amount of the nine bonds.  This means that each bond costs us $9.42 or $9.42/1000 or $0.0942.  This is a solution to a basic algebra problem that we would write as, $252.XX = $252.X

The position of your own body and feet could be making your face look droopy and tired! Here are some ways to keep your face looking alert when you're on your feet for a long time:<n><n> - Look straight ahead instead of looking below and slightly to the side.<n> - Try to hold your head upright.<n> - SIT on your heels (don't bend your legs) rather than walking or standing around. This will keep you more upright and relieve pressure on your back and neck (and avoid backaches!), making you look more alert.<n><n><n>###<n>The best way

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:To what part of your home is your morning paper delivered? Count the number of tents at the campground.<n>2. Divide the count by 270 to get the part per hundred that represents the number of families on the camping trip (not the number of individual campers).<n>3. Add the part per hundred you got from the campground to the part per hundred you get from the school, and use your total as the part per thousand.  How much more in part per thousand is there at the school than at the campground?<n><n>Input: There are 7 campsites at a park and each site accommodates 2 campers. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where does a shadow usually appear? Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n><n>### Response:		The shadow appears on all sides.<n>

How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:If electrical equipment won't power on, what connection should be checked? Choices:  A: company B: telephone netwok C: airport D: wires E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		If the connection can be found, use the letter code corresponding to the correct answer.<n><n>### Response 2:If none of the connections can be found, state the reason why.<n><n>### Review Answer:The airport is the only place that the connection can be found<n><n>#Instruction:Answer the following questions.<n>### Question:<n>What is the mathematical process step in which a mathematical model is created by translating the real world problem into an equation? <n><n>### Demostration:<n>A model is created by translatiing the problem in to an equation. An example would be x=5. 5 times 5 is 25. <n><n>### Question:When trying to reduce your time for a competition, how long should you take to study during a test?<n><n>### Demastination:<n>Depends on the test. If it is a subject I know very well I would be spending the whole period studying. Otherwise, a third of the class period is how long I would spend on the average test.<n><n>### Question. <n>Your son is about to get a speeding ticket. You can give him the money to go and pay it. Or you can take him to court to dispute it. <n><n>##Demostration:<n>If the ticket is around $70 then it is better that we just give him the money rather than wasting time and energy in court. <n><n>##Question:What are the steps of scientific method? Choices:   A: observing the phenomena, defining the variables and developing a hypothesis. B: developing a hypothesis, measuring the observations against the hypothesis and using data to support the hypothesis. C: defining the variables, measuring the observations and using data to support a hypothesis. D: collecting data, analyzing the result and repeating the procedure. E: collecting data, developing a hypothesis, measuing observations against the hypothesis.<n><n>##Demastration:<n>The steps of the scientific method are<n>Collecting data<n>Anaylising data<n>Presenting data<n><n>###Review Answer: <n>B,C,D and E<n><n>###Question:What is the difference between a probability and a ratio?<n><n>##Demastecation:<n>The difference between a probability and ratio is that a probability cannot be negative. Ratio's can have negative numbers or positive

Choices:  A: scotland B: europe C: race track D: new jersey E: england<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructor Guidelines:<n>### Review:Answer the questions below.<n>Question1: In Scotland there is a highway, which travelers use as a public thoroughfare. They pay no toll and pass through it without obstruction of any sort, even stopping when necessary. The Scottish Highlands, in this sense, include the country at the south, and from the eastern coast to the sea with the north.<n><n>Question2: Question 2 The English highway, on the other hand, is a toll road. In England the roads are generally private, and no one has a right to travel over them without permission of the owner. The toll is fixed at first, and the taxes are paid on every horse that passes.<n><n>### Additional Information:Where is a road, known as a toll, in the United States? Choices: A : new jersey B: the northeast coast C: all states D: no state roads<n><n>### Addtional Instructions:In the United States and in Scotland, the toll is a payment required from each traveler on every horse that passes, to cover the expense of the road. It is possible that the owner of toll does not charge any money to those who travel with a coach or wagon.<n><n>### Response1:In addition, England has a vast number of public thoroughfares, or highways.<n><n><n><n>### Addtnal Review:<n>Question1:In England they have a toll. Toll is a tax upon the use of any public thoroughfare. (public highway).<n><n>### Question2:In Scotland they have a toll too, but it is quite different. It gives the right of passage upon any public thoroughfare. There is the right for the public to pass.<n><n>### Tutorials:<n><n>* [Tutorial](https://www.udemy.com/data-modeling-and-database-design/learn/lecture/59690593)<n>* [Lecture](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zZF7qr32b3Y)<n><n>### References:<n>* https://www.udacity.com/wiki/ud243-data-modeling-tutorial<n>* https://www2.udacity.com//www2.

If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. Explai<n>### Instrucations (optional)<n>### Use the following paragraph and instructions to help you get started.<n><n>### What:<n>Write a paragraph explaining the difference between the past, present, and future forms of the verb _to have_. For example, we have and we will have .  We had and we would have .  We are having and we will have , and so forth.<n><n>### Do:<n>Write a paragraph describing the differences in past, present, and futrue form of the verb _to _have_. Illustrate the time frame in a story or in a series of events in your own life with the three forms of _to have_.  <n><n>### Do Not:<n>Do not simply list the three forms of _have_ as is.<n><n>### Examples (optional)<n>## Write a paragraph that shows different aspects of a personality trait you either have or know someone who has.<n><n>## Notes:<n><n>### Instructor:<n>Check, if necessary, the following: spelling, grammar, mechanics, vocabulary, and development.<n><n>### Student:<n>Answer the following: (1) _What am I writing?_ (2) _Did I answer the question?_ (3) _Did I do what I was supposed to do?_ (4) _Have I learned anything from this lesson?_ (5) _How does this relate to my life so far?_ (6) _What would I put in a portfolio for this assignment?_<n><n>### Checklist:<n>### Check that you did all the following:<n>### Check whether you have a single space after the period or colon _(I_ do not have _many)._ <n>### Check whether the period goes or does not go with the quotation mark (_I do not have that much money._  )<n>### Check for plural or singular verbs for _they_ and
