There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What does one chop us a grape for? Choices:  A: fresh fruit B: wine press C: fruit basket D: fruit cocktail E: picnic basket<n><n>### Response:		A. Fresh fruit<n><n>### Instructor Guide:<n>These questions are from https://codekits.org/en/puzzles/54-multiples-of-10-multiple-choice-questions<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:James was a student who had a report that is due tomorrow.  Where might he spend most of his time today? Choices:  A: university B: college class C: class room D: classroom E: library<n><n>### Response:		James was a student spent his time in the library<n><n>### Input:(2,8,15,23,31,39...)<n><n>### Response:(3,9,15,24,36,54...)<n><n>### Demand:<n>Input: The ratio of the population of Cedar, Iowa and Chocolate City, Colorado is 24:15. What is the population of Cedarlo, Iowa?<n>Answer: 6616<n><n>Input: A rectangle is 24 feet long and 32 feet wide. What length and width is double the area of the rectangle?<n>Answer: 48 feet long x 128 feet wide<n><n>Input: If 1, 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, __, __ then what goes last?<n>Answer: <n><n>### Input (2500,996,681,495,372,215,199,199,__)<n><n>### Response (4)<n><n>### Input ((1,1,4), (199,1,6), (16,199,3))<n><n>### Response ((1,1,9), (394,3))<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:James went to the best steakhouse outside of the South.  Where is James? Choices:  A: dairy farm B: texas C: building D: michigan E: florida<n><n>### Response:		<n>The choices are in two categories.  Choices that are outside the South are (A(D), B(C), and E(florida).  Choices in Texas are (A(D)).  Choices in either Dairy farm, Mich or building are, (B(C)).  So my answer here is either Texas or a dairy farm.<n><n>### Input:(15 times the difference between nine times the number of apples times the average number of oranges plus the average number of orangess times the difference between nine multiplied by the number of oranges to the original number of apples)<n><n>### Response<n>Since the difference between the number 9 and the number 10 is 1, the expression in the brackets has a 1, and for the second 9, again, is reduced by one, and then the average of both is added together, this reduces my number in the fraction by a factor of 2, so my number in the fraction is 1/2. I then divide each of my numbers in my equation by the 1/2, and end up with the original number of appales.<n><n>###<n>

If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? There are twice as many percussion players<n><n>### ResponseInches: 258<n><n>### Input 6 hours past noo[n]<n><n>### Error<n><n>110 members.<n><n>110 total members, and 57 woodwinds, and 10 brass players = 1,790 members (316 x 5); total is 57 woodwinst<n><n>### InputJennie and Peter go fishing. Peter catches 8 fish and tells Jennie that he has 4 times as many fish as she caught. How many fish does Peter have in total?<n><n>### ResponsePeter has 32 fish.<n><n>### Input3 hours past noon<n><n>### Error 90065502<n><n>### InputHalf as many seashells<n><n>### Response54 seashells (as many as she would have caught if she caught 20 seashells on every day)<n><n>### InputIt rained 4 inches<n>

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:If I need deodorant, where do I go to but some? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A: C<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>The question implies that the place where you go to buy deodorants is _the_ location to buy them, which is a definite article and means just one location (your answer is C, the grocery store.)<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: What do we need to get an animal at the pet store? <n><n>Input: To get an animal at a pet store, __________________<n><n>### Response<n><n>Response: We don't say that we actually buy an entire animal from the pet store. We buy the animal at the pet store (the animal is part of the transaction).<n>

How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:When people want to watch a new move, the often go see it at the? Choices:  A: town B: conference C: bathroom D: theater E: train station<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanation:This movie theater only has 3 bathrooms so most people will go to the theater if they have time if not they will spend the time waiting in the bathroom.<n><n>### Input:[The bus is running late.]<n><n>### Response:[I'm glad! Use each word exactly as written in the question or prompt.<n><n>### Multiple Choice:Ms. Keller knows that each item of the set a, b, c, and d is in a different house. Which of the following can be true about the sets and the houses? Choices: A: a and b are in different houses, but c and d are both in Dracula's house B: a and c are in Dracula' s house but b and d are both in the house with the best pool C: only Dracula resides in the house with the worst pool D: only Frankenstein resides in the house where each item of the set is housed in a different house<n><n>### Answer<n><n>A<n><n>### Multiple choice:You are at the park with 5 friends. He has a problem, and there is only one way to solve it."<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Mr. Goski has had a problem ever since he opened in his store in 1830. He has inventory on the shelves but there are only eight days in the month. He has inventory that needs to be sold but he can only sell it for eight days.  What is his largest problem?  How much money should he spend on inventory for next month's income?<n>Answer: Spend $128.80 for inventory<n><n>### Input:"I wish Mr. Goski had a smaller problem."<n><n>### Response:"I wish he sold his store in 1978."<n><n>### Explanation:"Oh, that's a much easier problem."<n><n>----
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input Two:<n>On each of 4 Mondays in November, there was a rainstorm that lasted half as long as the rainstorms on the 5 preceding days. If the sum of the five rainstorms was 100 minutes, how long was the rainstorm on each of the 4 Mondays?<n>Answer 1: 30 minutes and 40 seconds<n><n>### Input<n>On each of 9 Tueadys, the rain lasted only one-half as long as the rain on the 8 preceding days. If the combined rain length was 70 hours and 20 minutes, how long did on Tuesday's rain last?<n>Answer 1 : 38 hours<n>

(For better marks, your answers should be detailed and show your learning process.)<n><n>### Input 1:<n>**Turtle:** When it rains, this turtle hides inside his house. He has 3 less turtles than his grandfather and this number of turtles is 6 times as many as his mother.<n>**Turtle Sizes**<n>Number | Name | Size | No. of Turtles<n>--- | --- | --- | ---<n>3 | Grandfather | 150 | 2<n>2 | Mother | 45 | 6<n>4 | Father | 65 | 3<n><n>How many turtles hid inside their house when it rains?<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>#### Input 1<n>There is the description of turtle and his family. We can count the number of turtles he has.<n>From the question, we learned that he has 6 turtles smaller than a grandfather, it means his grandfather is 6x bigger than turtles. Therefore, the grandfather is 3x bigger than the turtle mom, 2x bigger than grandfather, 8x bigger than the dad.<n><n>In order to solve this, we make a table with the number of the turtles and the size to easier to see the result.<n><n>|  Number   | Grandfather | Mother | Father |<n>| -------- | ------- | ------ | ------ |<n>| 1       | 150    | 45    | 64    |<n>| 2       | 300    | 96    | 128   |<n>| 3       | 450    | 144   | 192   |<n>| 4       | 600    | 191   | 247   |<n>| 5       | 750    | 247    | 345   |<n>| 6       | 901    | 300    <n><n>|  Final     | 764   |<n><n>Let's choose numbers from the table (as the smallest numbers as

On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: E: excrete.<n><n>The number of human sexes (A, B, C, D), the number of human legs (E), and the number of mistakes (F) are all inverses of the same set. The human sexes have 2 opposite legs, and the human legs go 2 opposite directions. The human legs get tired and need to be released by making mistakes, which are the human sexes' excretions.<n><n>### Input<n><n>#### Instructions:<n>Propose an algorithm that computes the integer part of a number.<n>Your proposal should be a sentence that starts with the sentence fragment below.<n><n>#### Example:<n>The algorithm returns an integer that is the remainder of a number when it is divided by 1 followed by a period.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Input:<n>I. It must be written in English.<n><n>II. It must begin with the sentence fragment: The algorithm...<n><n>#### Response:<n>>It computes the integer part by subtracting the quotient from 1 without any remainder.<n><n>### Credit:<n>* [Task](https://app.codility.com/programmers/lessons/in_a_series/)<n>* [Answers](https://github.com/CodeDive/LeetCode/blob/master/Resources/Leetcode-in-series.md)<n>

Please assist me with understanding your idea.<n><n>### Input :  Your friend tells you that she wants to hire a housekeeper. She wants to pay as low as possible. So the question for you is: How can you help a friend get the lowest fair wage possible?<n><n>### Demension:<n>### Answer :  When employing a housekeeper, she should hire someone who is competent in a particular task for example cleaning. This person will be able to assist her in cleaning faster as opposed to if she employs a person who is not competent and is also paid by the hour.<n>### Input : You ask a friend to choose one of three different-colored balloons. You tell your friend that there are two white balloons and one grey balloon. You friend chooses a green balloon. What color was their second choice?<n><n>###  Demonstarion:<n>### Answer  : White was their second choice<n><n>### Input  :<n>### Answer  You have 5 ounces of ice cream and 1 cup of ice cream. If you put the 1 cup in the 5 ouces how much does it weigh?<n><n>### Answer:<n>1/2 - Ounces<n>### Input :<n>### Anwer:<n>When there is two objects that have been placed on the same unit of mass, then the mass will be half the original mass that the original unit was.<n>### Input:  Your friend asks you to help him with a math problem. He is supposed to find the difference between 122 and 387. How do you know if he's done the math right?<n>### Answer: Your friends answer will be the difference of the number given above by subtracting the lower number to the larger number. This means subtracting 387 to 122.

Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		E<n>1. A, Tropics = B, Nightmare because they have to feed on flesh<n>2. B, Nightmare = B, Nightmere because they has to hide because they are nocturnal<n>3. C, Wyoming = A, Tropics = A, Tropics because they like temperate land and food<n>4. D, Bushes = D, Bushes because they are not afraid

Tom works for the 20 hour, and John works for the 160 hour. It takes Tom 3 hours to do the job, while John does the same task in 4 hours. How many total hours can the job be done in?<n><n>### answer: 14<n><n>### Solution- If Tom works for 20 hours, and John worked for the other 140 hours that leaves John with 10 hours. 10 hours x 4 is 40. So, it's pretty simple to figure out this isn't about how much time they can be off by in their own work. Just count by how many hours they each work and you'll see they can do it in 160.<n>### Input/Output:Jane is the third wheel in a bicycle ride. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:A person is putting on makeup, what is their likely goal? At 9:15 Tuesday he is walking back at the same time on the same side of the street. If the vase is still on the street, how long has he been walking?<n>Answer: less than 12 minutes<n><n>Input: Dwayne is standing on a beach with his friend Gabe. Gabe is twice as tall as Dwayne. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where would you find isopropol alcohol and safety glasses? Choices:  A: pub B: restaurants C: in a park D: supermarket E: chemistry lab<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Option A is incorrect.<n>Option B is correct.<n>Option C is incorrect.<n>Option D is correct.<n>Option E is incorrect.<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the table below. Write your response at the end of the table.<n><n>|**Item**  |**Cost**  |<n>|--------------|-------------|<n>|50 pencils | $1.00     |<n>|2 boxes of glue | $3.00   |<n>|1 pack of markers | $0.30   |<n>|2 packs of erasers | $3.05    |<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Instructon:Complete the grid below of the fraction 1/3 of 2. Enter the answer in terms of whole numbers.<n><n>### Response Code:<n>|**Value**|**Fraction**|**Answer**|<n>|-------------|-------------|--------------|<n>|2|1/6|<n>|3|1/10|<n>|2|5/6|<n>|13|5/13|<n><n>### Instinctation:Complete the grid below. Write your answers in terms of fractions or decimals.<n><n>### **Input**|**Increase or decrease**|**Output**<n>|**Add**|**1/12**|**1/4**<n>|**Multiply**|**11/19**|**The quotient of 11 x 2 divided by 19**<n>|**Multiple**|**2/5**|**The quotent of 2 x 3 divided by 5**<n><n>Example:<n><n>**Input**: 11/19<n><n>**Increase**or **decrease**:<n><n>**Output**:2/5<n><n>### Insturictions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instruction:Write a response that appropriately finishes the sentence.<n><n>### Input<n>- If a, b, and c are whole numbers, how do you solve 4(a b c) +(3 a + 7 b c)?<n>Option A: Multiply 4(a b-c) by 3 and then add 3(a + 7b-c).

How many bookshelves would you have to have for each CD to be on a separate shelf?<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### Response 1:The number does not tell us much that would enable us to deduce the number of shelves required.<n><n>### Response2: The number indicates that some books would have to be shared on one shelf.<n>### If you find the answer satisfactory, tick 'Satisfied',otherwise,  tick 'Unsatisfied'<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n><n>### Response:		Concert<n><n>### Explanation of how you arrived at your chosen answer<n><n>First,I count the total number of options available.  There is one option (choice) that starts with "A."    Total number of choice = A + B + C + D + E <-- 1 +1 + 1 + 1 +1 = 6 <n><n>I use the "counting from left to right" technique for the available options.   <n><n>Since i don't know which option is correct, I choose the top option.  I find A + C <-- A and C<n><n>I then subtract each option with A and end up with 3 remaining choices which is not enough to complete the task.  Since there is not enough information, I will not pick.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Input: While riding on a car, a man has 20 passengers and 35 suitcases to haul. A passenger takes 20 suitcases to a hotel.  How many passengers and suitcases does the man have left?<n>Answer: 40 passengers and 25 suitcases<n><n>Input: Bob takes 1/3 of his money and invests it in an account at a bank yielding 10%.  He also invests 1/2 his money in accounts yielding 8%.  How much does he end up investing?<n>Answer: $13,000<n>

If so, you may request to see special artwork that is normally not allowed in the public, but only for your birthday.<n><n>### Input<n>>  Name: Unknown.  <n>>  Name: Jane.<n><n>### Response<n>>  Age: Unknown.<n><n>### Output<n>Welcome to the Museum, Jane. How many times have you been here?<n><n>### Input1:<n>When do you come to enjoy our lovely museum?<n><n>### Response1:<n>>  I come on Sundays (S, D).  <n>>  I come during weekends (S, D).<n><n>### Response2:<n>>  I never visit the museum! (N)<n><n>### Input2:<n>When do you visit the museum, Jane?<n><n>### Output2:<n>Great! We would LOVE to see you more often!<n><n>### Input3:<n>I was wondering if you can help me?<n><n>### Responses:<n>>  I'm really sorry, the curator is not available.<n><n>### Next week (S)<n>>  I'll come next week (S): 08/29-09/04.  <n>>  I'd like to show my kid to (M): 08/15-08/22 (S)<n><n>### The next day (D):<n><n>### Next Sunday (S):<n><n>### After a week (S, D):<n><n>### Two week (S, D, ):<n><n>### A month (M, S, D):<n><n>>  I hope you will visit us again soon!<n><n>### At first (S, D, M):<n><n>>  The curator will be available from 12/01 until 12/10.  <n>>  The curators are available every day between 12/11-12/1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n><n>### Response:		 C:spread disease <n><n>### Explanation:<n>The correct answer is choice E:spread diseases. The question itself is a question.<n><n>

How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Choices:  A: happiness B: sore muscles C: injury D: perfection E: errors<n><n>### Response:		E-errors<n><n>### Input:(You have three options to choose from.)<n>**Riddle: A man is walking a long road. From each of his first 25 steps after starting, the man's shadow remains the same. From his 30th step onward, it changes, with each step growing by 2.5 feet.** **When will the man's shadow reach his true size?**<n><n>### Response:(You must first eliminate a choice if it is not a reasonable answer.)<n>A: When 30 steps from the end of the road<n>B: When 25 steps from the beginning of the road<n>C: When exactly 35 steps from the end of his first 24 steps<n>D: When exactly 30 steps from his last step.**<n><n>### Input(This may or may not be the correct answer.)<n>When will the man'ss shadow reach his true size??<n><n>### Response (Write your answer below)<n><n>### Riddle Input:<n>**Riddle: How can three bells make three distinct sounds if their individual sounds are exactly the same?**<n><n>## Response:<n>How can three bells make 3 distinct sounds?<n><n>### Input (This might or might not be the right answer)<n>A)  All the bells are made by the same bell maker.<n><n>### Other Options<n><n>B)  Two of the three bells are identical except for where they were made.  Thus after they ring, they each sound the exact same thing.<n><n>C)  The bells are identical, and you can hear the other three bells ringing without hearing any one bell.  There are an infinite number of bells that could produce that sound.<n><n>### Response(Answer the question below)<n><n>## Other Resources for this Challenge:<n>### Example Questions: https://www.mathnasium.com/sites/all/files/u3_task_8_multiple_choice__practice_test_1.pdf<n>### Sample Math Practice Tests: https://www1.umn.edu/ohr/careers/students/practice_tests/samples/math_test_prac.pdf<n>

Choices:  A: vessel B: box C: transistor D: submarine E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:The problem with the toll booth is that it doesnâ€™t take credit cards. There is another toll booth that does take credit cards, so a good backup plan is required. What is the best order to stop at the 4 toll booths to avoid incurring unnecessary fees?<n><n>The 4 toll booeths are labeled with an A through D. Each booth has the following rules:<n><n>* Booths A, B, and C take the same cards (cash, credit, debit).<n>* Booth D takes cash only.<n>* Booth A takes credit cards.<n>* Booths B, C, and D take lesser-costed cards than booth A.<n>* A, B, and D accept both lesser- and same-cost cards.<n>* Boooths C and D take the same card types.<n><n>### Input(if any):<n>```c<n>a>b<n>d<c<n>a=D<n>d<b<a<n>```<n><n>### Output(if any):<n>B,C,A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The toll booth with A,B,C should be used. (A is closest to D, so D can be used as a backup if necessary.) The cards used at A,B,C are all different and it does not make any difference what order the booths are taken, so it doesn't matter which booth you visit first.<n><n>### Response(if any):<n>The toll booteh that takes the same card types needs to be visited last since the cards used are all different<n><n>### Insturctions:<n>Write a program that takes a single argument and performs a task. Write a command or statement to do the task 2 different ways and  have your task evaluated on 2 different inputs<n><n>### Input:(if any)<n>```sh<n>./test.py 4<n>8<n><n>./test.py -1<n>7<n>```<n><n>## Input:Input 5 and a single number<n>### Output:<n>```bash<n>  [*] 4 times your number: (64)<n>  [*] The largest prime factor: (2)<n>    - 2<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:Ask for a single digit

Video Recorder<n><n>### Answer:  E<n><n>### Instructive Choices:  A) a cabinet has cable b) a desk has no cable c) a television is the answer d) a desk is the answer<n><n>### AnswerThe probability of a doctor getting cancer in each group are the following:<n><n>### Doctors in group A:  1/3000 or 1: 3000<n><n>### Doctor in group B: 8/260 or 8: 260 or 5/80<n><n>### Probability of a doctor in group A getting cancer = 1: 3,000<n><n>Probability of a doctor is group B getting cancer = 5/80 (8/260) = 3/5 + \1/5 or 7/15<n><n>### Probalby = 1:3,000 or 7/100 or 7:100 or 35<n><n>### Summary of answers<n>#### A. 50%<n>#### B. 100%<n><n>#### C. 60%<n>#### D. 40%

If we think the calculator does this automatically it is not true. The device contains a series of electronic circuits that can be programmed to calculate, the same as a computer. If we use a calculator for solving some simple questions it will take a few seconds, we will use it for solving complex problems, it can take several minutes.

How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:James was cooling off two quickly.  He would die if he didn't find some way to stop what? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A<n>Answer: Maine<n><n>### Feedback:The answer was correct on three levels of interpretation: in terms of the original context (North America), for that coast (â€œeastâ€), for that coast line (â€œeastâ€), and in terms of location (coastal).<n><n>### In the context of American geography and culture it is commonly known as Maine, a coastal state. In this context, when people say â€œNorth Americaâ€ they are referring to the countries of United States and Canada â€“ which, together also make the continent of North America. Given that the context is America and that we are talking about a coastline, option D is incorrect â€“ the North American coastline would refer to the ocean, not the countries.<n><n>### In terms of geography and topography of the area, Maine does not have a coastline:<n>* Maine has over 3,000 miles of coastline.<n>* The coast of Maine on the Atlantic Ocean is home to some of the most rugged and isolated land in the United States.<n>* Maineâ€™s rocky coastline is the least known coastline in Main.<n>* Maineâ€™ s coast is the only land on the eastern seaboard that is not part of a major metropolitan area.<n><n>### It therefore follows that the answer was found in main-land not island.<n>### Reference:https://www.worldatlas.com/articles/the-coastline-of-main.html<n><n>### Input A. If the number of books in the library are reduced by the number of books that were removed from shelves, then the number of books remaining is:<n>* A: 50<n>* B: 100<n>* C: 130<n>* D: 300<n>* E: none of these<n><n>### Demostration for Option C:<n>The number of books remaining is 130.<n>* Subtract 75 from 175 to find the number of books that are removed. <n>* Subtract that number from 175. Then subtract 74 from 126, and we already have the number of the books to be found.<n><n>### Feeback option C is the correct answer, although option D has also a similar reasoning.<n><n><n>

How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. Next after that, I type 14 + 21 and the answer equals to be, 35 and then I check the answer, in this case the answer Yes. <n>Now I'm in 13 + 35. The answer equals to be 48 and I check if the answer is Yes.<n><n>### Output<n>The output of this question is to say, using the calculator, that I wrote the answer of 13 +35 equal to be 48.<n><n>### Rationale<n>What I think is the answer for this question is that the question, how do you answer 13 +21, and the answer is 14, and then I check if the answer can be Yes or Not and it equals to be yes. Next I am moving to what answer I will type and it equals to be 14 + 35, and yes I check the answer and it equals to be Yes. Therefore, I think this is the right question answer.<n><n>### Input <n>5 + 3 less than A  is 2.  If A is 98, how many are not used? Choices:  _____<n><n>### Response <n>2<n><n>### Rational <n>What I think is that, the input of this question is to answer 5 + 3 less, if A is 98 then how many are not used. Therefore, I think, that the answer should be 98 - 5 - 3 = 90 - 5  = (35/2) /2 = 17.<n><n>It can be check that the answer the question (answer with the biggest bracket) can be the answer, therefore, I think this is also the right answer.<n><n>## Export to Docx<n><n>Export command: | python3 -m nlpconvert question<n><n>

How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:A person lived in my what? How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:East coast areas such as Florida are found where? Choices:  A: florida B: denmark C: united states D: map E: california<n><n>### Response:		East coast areas are a result of water flowing from the north<n><n>### Input:"I heard on the radio this morning that we could see some snow showers in the coming week. The forecast for tomorrow is for 6 showers at noon." How many showers would we expect by tomorrow evening?<n><n>### Response:$5434<n><n>### Input"The 100-meter dash took place last Monday evening. Everyone finished with a personal record time. The top female competitor won the race in 8.8 seconds. The top male competitor finished in 10.4 seconds. How much faster was the winning female times versus the winning male time?"<n><n>### Response:"A female competitor in the 100-meters dash is 4 times faster than a male competitor"<n><n>### Instructions"A group of pigs with 21, 13 and 6 legs can climb to the top of a fence, but need to have a total of 64 legs to finish the climb"<n><n>### Demostration"64 - 63 =? 64 - 62 =? 64-62"<n>### Response"The pig that has 21 legs is too large to fit. That is because you need 64 legs to complete the climb and the answer is 123, if you have that pig you need an additional 64 legs"<n><n>### Input""Every other Friday, my father picks me up from the airport at 10:53 and takes me to his office. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Sometimes fighting inflation isn't even what, because it is so negligible? Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the questions.<n><n>### Question 1:<n>How much do you think one could make in a year if they worked at a supermarket?<n><n>**Input**: $84,000 (annually)<n><n>**Answer**: We can estimate that a typical person working full time would make about $25 in a day. Therefore, we could estimate that one would make about $630 a month, in a year $7920.<n><n>### How could you know how much one could make in a given profession if they went to school?<n><n>**Input 2:** You can ask people, if they are currently in that profession, and then use that number to estimate potential earnings from going to school.<n><n>**Question**: You see someone working at a restaurant. What could you estimate the person makes an hour?<n><n>**Answer 2**: You could easily ask them to see if you would be closer to the estimate in your answer or theirs, and then use that to estimate the hourly wage.<n><n>**Reasons for Answer A**.  You could ask another person, see how they agree, and use the estimate.<n><n>**Reason for Answer B**: The information about how much a person might make from working at a restaurant is available.<n><n><n>### You see that you can afford just over a $ for lunch. How much do you think you could afford to put towards this month's mortgage payment?<n><n>**Input:** About $1300<n><n>**Answer:** The rule of 72.   $1,300 would be about $1,000, then double it, then do it again then adjust for inflation.<n><n>### Answer:<n>How many trees and flowers could you plant or raise if you had $10,000 for land and equipment?<n><n>**Inputs:** About $15,800.<n><n>**Answer: You could probably buy about 40 gallon containers of plants, potting soil, and seeds, then find locations for planting, then buy the land for planting.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>The town council estimates the number of tents they will need for the upcoming music festival. Choices: A: pink B: purple C: brown D: blue<n><n>**Answer: B**<n><n>### Input - Question<n><n>### Response - Answer<n><n>### Input-Question<n><n>Input: A chestnut is half as heavy as an acorn.  A squirrel takes three times as many acorns as it does chestnuts.  Sally buys only acorns and chestnuts at a cost per 100 calories of $0.30 per acorn and $0.70 per chestnut. Suppose Sally had 1,000 acorns and 5,000 chestnuts. How many of each item did Sally end up with if each acorn contains 2,000 calories?<n><n># Solution<n><n>**Acorns:** `acorns = (3 / 1) * $0.30 * 1,001` = $1,000<n><n><n>**Chestnuts:** `chestnuts = 1,003 - (5 / 1) * (1000)` = 4,597 acorns - 5,009 chestnuts = $3,497<n><n>Input: 25% of 82 - 50.00 =<n><n>### Input <n>### Response <n>19<n>### Input<n>### Response<n>### Input<n>41% of 2345 = 1049.9<n>### Input 4/6 of 250 = 125<n><n>### Input and output<n>9745/24 = 405.075

(2x & + 3) <= 3<n>#### Demonstrations for 3, 4, 5, 6, 7<n>#### for 0, 1, or 2 are incorrect.<n><n>#### Input 1:For what value v is v<4 and 6>v<n><n>#### Response 1:The input value must be 3.<n><n><n>#### Instrucction 3:For which value of x is the word statement true for an addition sentence?<n>x + x = x<n>#### Demonstrate:For any value of x, addition is true:<n>* x = 1 + 1 = 2<n>* y = 2 + 4 = 6<n>* x = 7 + 7 = 14<n>* x = 5 + 6 = 11 (not 2 = 0)<n>* x = 4 + 3 = 7<n>* x = 6 + 5 = 11<n><n><n>#### Instruction 4:In the sequence: x, x+1, x+2, x+ 4, and x+6, which term is missing? x = 1. x+1 = 2. x+2 = 3. x+4 = 4. x+6 = 6.<n><n>#### Demonstrat:The missing term is x+3.<n>#### Demostration:3 is the number after the 2, but not the next number 4.<n><n>### Constructive Input:Write any number as a sum of prime numbers. 1 is not a prime number so don't write one.<n><n>### Solution

How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. Then there are 3 days passed since yesterday.<n>

Choices:  A: personal B: special C: shiny D: rare E: irregular<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:A: In the statement â€œThere are 56 cards numbered 1-152 that are common, special, shiny, rare, irregular, personal, or different in some other way.<n><n>**Step 1:** Read the given statement, "There are 56****cards***numbe***1-152* that are common, special." The blank in the beginning must be one word, so it can only be "shiny," "rare," "irregular," or "personal.". This means one possible answer is A: (shiny).<n><n>**Step 2:** When looking at the middle part of the statement "that are common," we can exclude letters A-D as options. These are answers choices that don't fit the statements.<n><n>**Step *A:*** This leaves options C and E as the correct answer.<n><n>**Step **B:** We've narrowed down our answers to C-E. The middle part of the statement says that the "***cards***numbe 1..." We know that there are 56 cards, so we can exclude all options other than E. From here, we can look at the statement "***152* that ar". We know that 56 cards were numbered 1-56, so the *56 numbered***cards that are irregular, personal, or regular can't have ***1***- ***56*** as their number on the card. This leaves us with the right answer of E.<n><n><n>### Input:"The doghouse has 4 doors. A dog can enter the doghouse from any of the doors, except the do"<n>### Response:B<n>### Demo:<n>Step 1: Read the first sentence. This sentence contains the word "house," which could be an animal house, a home, or another kind of place.<n><n>Step 2: Underline the word "dog." This tells us that the subject of the sentence is some kind of dog.<n><n>Step 3: Underline the words "doors." There are 4 doors, and the sentence tells us that they can only be used by "dogs."<n><n>Step 4:"Dogs can enter the doghouse through any of the four doors except...." The blank shows that dogs can enter the doghouse except through

Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		<n>A or C<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the book [Cracking the GRE math 2014 Edition](https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-GRE-Math-Strategies-Methods/dp/0983996697/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1515993137&sr=8-1&keywords=cracking+the+gmat+2014) I found that the 3 most common answers to the "Where is a paper notice..." question is A, D and B. My conclusion was that either A or C were the right answer and D was not a correct answer in a logical way of thinking about it. It says A or D in the book. However, my conclusion was that A only because A is a more likely place than D for a paper notice to be left and D is least likely due a paper notice to be somewhere to be left somewhere.<n><n>### Examples<n><n>There were some examples mentioned in [this answer](https://gmatclub.com/forum/question-90946.html). In this one, notice was hung on classroom door. What was the last part of the question?<n><n>### References<n><n>[GRE Math Tips Book](https://www.powells.com/book/cracking-the-gre-verbal-2018-cracking-the)

Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The obsessive man was always washing hands, he had even done it so much once that it caused a what? Choices:  A: use soap B: irritation C: cleanliness D: thinking E: wet towel<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice questions: How much time does it take to find the solution? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Mary wasn't familiar with James, so she wasn't comfortable speaking with him. How might she come off? Choices:  A: cold B: unfamiliar C: unknown D: unacquainted E: shy<n><n>### Response:		James is Mary's acquaintance. He isn't unfamiliar. He isn't James's acquaintance and he isn't familiar with James. He is unacquainted with James. Mary's unfamiliar with James and he is unacquaintaned with Mary. Mary's shy around James and he is unfamiliar with Mary.<n><n>### Input:[1: A] + [B] + [C]= [2: E]<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>2 = 3+2+3<n><n>### Input:{2: E} - [3: A] - [4: B] = [5: C]<n><n>### Response:[A:] + {B:] + [C:D] = E:D<n><n>### Instructions:<n> 1 If you're familiar, you are unfamiliar.<n> 2 If you aren't unfamiliar, you are familiar.<n> 3 If you know someone, you aren't acquainted with them.<n> 4 If you are familiar with someone, then they are familiar with you.<n> 5 Unacquainted people aren't familiar, are unacquainted, and aren't known.<n> 6 Unfamiliar people aren't known, are unacqunainted, and arenâ€™t familiar.<n> 7 If you are unacquaintancd with someone,  you don't know someone.<n>

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a dictionary while you're using it? Choices:  A: library B: study area C: table D: classroom E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		What does this question mean? Input and choices are meaningless.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>It seems that the student is confused about this question, which is meaningless. "Where would you put a book while you're using" it? Is the question about placement and/or usage of something? The question is either so badly constructed that it is not understandable, or it is incomplete, without any answers. <n><n>### Conclusion:<n>It's easy to ask a good question, but it's not easy doing a great job of it. Don't be discouraged. Some good questions take practice. <n><n><n><n>

How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:If I have a vintage, decorative light source in my possession, what is it likely to be? Choices:  A: sun B: sky C: candle D: house E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: If I have a vintages, decorative light source inn my possession, what it is likely to be.<n>Choices:<n><n>A) sun<n><n>B) sky<n><n>C) candle<n><n>D) house<n><n>E) lamp      <n><n>### Demostration:<n>The statement you are considering is the following:<n>"If I have a vampire in my possession,what is it likely to be: A) sun, B) sky, C) candle, D) house, E) lamp".<n><n>The answer you need to give is "E) a lamp".<n>  <n>The correct answer should be:<n><n>E) a lamp<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>The sentence consists of three parts: If I have a, a is vampire and what is it likely to me.<n><n>To find the answer for question "what is it likely to me", we have to remove If I have a from the sentence:<n><n>    I have a vampires likely to me.<n>    Which will be:<n>I have a vampire.<n><n>Then there are four choices to answer:<n><n>Choice A:  Sun<n><n>Choice B:  Sky<n><n>Choice C:  Candle<n><n>Choice D:  House<n><n>    I have vampire in my posession and it's candle or house or sky or it's sun.<n><n>To find out vampire to choice, we have to use and/or, for example:<n><n>    I want and/or<n><n>Then will get:<n><n>    I AND/OR vampire<n><n>So: A) sun<n><n>B ) sky<n><n>C) Candle<n><n>D) House<n><n>Since in our situation we will have to choose only one of above, we have to use or (in English) <n><n>Since this is the task related to the English language, all sentences will be written in English form, so we have to follow it and use English symbols.<n><n>Then final answer will be E) lamp<n><n>For confirmation, we can ask the question to the question:<n><n>"What's it that you are thinking of: A) sun, or B) sky or Candle or House or lamp?"<n><n>The answer you should be: "Lamp".<n><n>This question will not be very difficult if we will follow

The RUC's first president, Martin Luther King Jr., also had a UU background, and his influence has been credited with bringing a new generation of UU pastors into leadership roles.[21][25]<n><n>### Problem:The Revised Universalist movement became popular in the 1960s and 1970s, when it began attracting large numbers of young people dissatisfied with the mainstream mainstream Protestant churches. By 1970, they had become the most popular church in the United States with a membership nearly as large as the Roman Catholic Church and the Lutheran Church. In 1997 the RUCC was founded by Mark Epstain, a church leader, theologian and activist in Berkeley, CA. In 2006 the Revised Universalist church of Christ began holding worship services in New York City. The new church is openly gay and affirming of all sexual orientations and self-identities. The choices, B and D, represent a horse but are incomplete; these cannot answer the question.<n><n>## Solution:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Answer:The following are characteristics of yellow: Courageous, Fearless, English Carrier<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately shows (or calculates) the answer to the task.<n><n>### Answer1:In this question, it will be more efficient to compute:<n><n>total rainfall over 3 days = 10 in<n>rain on tuesday = 3 in<n>rain on monday = 12<n>rain on sunday = 6<n><n>Thus if we subtract 6 from the total, we will get the amount of rain on tuesday. Subtract that value from 3, we get that tuesday rained 3.<n><n>### Input1:<n>answer:C<n><n>### Answer2:<n>answer:B<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Write a reponse that appropriately shows ( or calculates) the answer.

If a twig is 20 inches long and 1 inch wide, how wide is his other ear?"<n><n>### Response C <n><n>### Output Roscoe's ear that is twice as big as the other ear will be 2 times X, this gives us a value for X of X=20-1 <n>When we divide X by 2 we get 10.  <n>10 is one half the value and his ear is equal to 10 inches. <n>The ears of his brother are equal to each other. So two times 5=10 inches, and one plus one is two. The answer is his brother's ears are equal to 10.<n><n>### **Input:** What is the missing number?<n>1, 16, 62, 151, 492<n><n>### **Response:**<n>491<n><n>### **Explanation:
