How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. A third girl walks up to them.  The number of girls at the table doubles when this girl joins them.  How many girls were originally at the table?<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>You have to complete the sentence.<n><n>An example: There are 11 boys in a room.  9 boys leave the room.  The number of boys left in the room is __________ the number in the room before the boys left.<n><n>### Response<n><n>An example:<n>The number of boys left in room before the boys left is equal to nine, because nine boys leave.<n>The answer is eleven.

The remaining amount is $60."<n><n>### Instructor Response:"Thank you for that excellent response. You answered the question correctly." <n>### Instructors Notes:This response is excellent and is both correct and concise. It's also noteworthy because we use the dollar sign after our decimals.<n>### Input"On Monday he had 20 fewer apples than Tuesday. On Wednesday he had 10 fewer apples than Thursday. On Thursday he went to the store and bought 5 apples to add to the total. Which day did he have 25 apples?" Choices: A: Thursday B: Monday C: Wednesday D: Tuesday E: None of the answers<n><n>### Response<n>Tuesday. His total amount of apples between Monday and Tuesday was 25. He gained 5 apples from the store on Thursday.  <n><n>### Instuctors Note: This answer is correct but not concise. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a theater which only has unpaid actors? Choices:  A: shopping mall B: hospitals C: populated area D: school E: military base<n><n>### Response:		D: School<n><n>### Instructions:If the average height of all members of the school's basketball teams in a particular year is 60 inches, which of the following statements is true?<n><n>A. The average weights each member in the high school basketball teams in this same year was 120 pounds<n><n>B. The average weights each members in the high school basketball team the prior year was higher than 60<n><n>C. The average weights each of the high school members in either year was 69.2 inches<n><n>D. The average height of the members of the high school basketball teams this year was more than twice the height of the average height of the members in the prior year<n><n>E. The average heights members in both years were the same<n><n>### Deminstration:<n><n>A. Each year the average heights of all members of high school basketball teams are about 60 inches. The average weights of high school basketball players are not recorded. The average height is not equal to twice the previous year's average height.<n><n>B. The students who played basketball this year are still in school. They are not recorded, and the weights of this year's students are not known. Therefore, if the average weights is higher than 60, it is due to students this year. If the average weights were not higher than 60 this year, then the previous year, the weights must have been higher than 60.<n><n>C. The student's weights are not a part of the equation, so they are not relevant. Therefore, answer E is the correct choice.<n><n>D. The statement is not true since only the heights are recorded, and weight is not determined by height.<n><n>### Answer: C<n><n>### Instuctions:Answer the question with either "is true" or "is false".<n><n>An employee of the bank is in the process of counting  a large number of $1 bills.  She found 100 $1 bills and subtracted 50 of them from  a pile which is  a multiple of 3.  Then she subtracted 35 more $1 bills from the remaining pile, again leaving a pile which is a multiple of 3 left.  She then took a fraction of that pile, and doubled the remainder.  Then she subtract the difference between that

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		<n>C - If she wants the velvet then she must go to the fabric store cause the jewelry store does not sell velvet. The clothing store and the grandmother's house do not sell velvet.<n><n>### Output:<n>There are five answers. Choose the one answer that best completes the sentence or best answers the question.<n><n>Input: On Monday in the morning, Jane ate 1/3 her weight in fruit and vegetables. On Tuesday morning her sister ate two-thirds her weight in fruit and Jane ate twice as much as her sister.  Jane lost three pounds. How much did her sister lose?<n>Output: her sister lost four pounds.<n><n>Input: Mr. Martinez goes to the same movie theater every Wednesday night.  He sees a movie for 2.5 hours during the latest late show during some of Wednesdays.  How many movie theaters show a movie for 2 hours and a half?<n>Output: there are three movie theaters that show a movie for 8.5 hours.<n>### Input:On Tuesday, the number of cows in the pasture decreased by five cows. On Wednesday, the number of sheep in the pen added 3 fewer sheep than the number on the Friday before. If the sheep pen had 62 sheep on Friday, how many were in the pen on Wednesday?<n>### Response:On Tuesday five cows were removed from pasture. Then on Wednesday 3 sheep were added to the pen. On Friday the pasture has six more sheep than on any other day then that many sheep are taken out. But on Tuesday five cowns are removed from the pen. The rest left in the pasture are a result of sheep being eaten in the last week. After Tuesday there are 62 sheep in the pen on Friday. Now on Wednesday there are 3 less sheep in the pasture than Friday after Tuesday. But there are 3 sheep more in the pasture than on Wednesday. That number of sheep are taken out. There are 2.9 sheep in 62 and 2.9 sheep are taken out of 2.9 sheep. The answer 65 is a solution (3.1 sheep is equivalent to.29 sheep) This answer does not

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Christian is twice as old as Brian. In eight more years, Brian will be 40 years old. How old will Christian be in eight years?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: It rained twice as much on Tuesday as Monday.  On Monday it rained 3 inches more than Sunday.  It rained 4 inches on Sunday.  How much total rainfall was there over the 3 days?<n>Answer: 25<n><n>Input: Anne drops a mirror and breaks it into 60 pieces. She sweeps up half of them, then her cat steals 3 pieces and her boyfriend picks up 1/3 of the remaining pieces. How many pieces does her boyfriend pick up?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Francis' family has 2 ukuleles, 4 guitars, and a certain number of violins. Each ukulele has 4 strings. Each guitar has 6 strings. Each violin has 4 strings. If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. How many more centimeters did it rain on Tuesdays than Mondays?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: The Reptile House at the zoo has 5 fewer animals than 3 times the number of animals housed in the Rain Forest exhibit. If the Reptile House has 16 animals, how many are in the Rain Forest exhibit?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:The explorers found a central passage, much to their delight it led straight to the ancient buried what? Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n><n>### Response:		It appears that the ancient buried tomb was a burial place for royal people, which may be accessed by a hidden passage through a large building.<n><n>### Input :The ancient burial tomb contains a series of passages, one of these was sealed to the point where it could not be accessed. One explorer noticed that the sealed passage way was at an elevation of -3 meters relative to the level of the central passage way. The explorer realized that the elevation might be the result of a change in water elevation that may have occurred as a result of a sudden thunderstorm. Did the elevations correspond in a certain way?<n><n>### Response :It is not apparent why the one explorer decided that the elevations corresponded in a certain way. However, it does appear to the observer that the explorers made the correct assumption that the elevation corresponds to changes in water elevation.<n><n>###Input: The team has only a 70% chance of making the playoffs. The other 11 teams in their own division have a 90% chance of making it. Of those 11 teams 2 of them have a lower than 40% chance of making a playoffs. How many teams have a chance better than 40% of making the playoffs?<n><n>###Response: The exploration team has a 40% chance the playoffs due to their 70% chance outshining their competition's 90% chance.  Of the remaining eleven teams, two have a chance of less than 40% in the playoffs. That leaves four teams that have a chance of greater than 40% at reaching the playoffs.<n><n>### Output: You have solved the puzzle.<n><n>###Output:The explorers have a 66% chance of successfully locating the ancient burial.<n><n>###Requirements:<n><n>* The instruction describes a problem.<n>* A response is defined for an input.<n><n>###Constraints: <n><n>* The instruction should consist of ten or less words. <n>* The response should consist of 5 or less words.

Choices:  A: walmart B: loft C: house D: home depot E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		Answer according to the following rules:<n>If the man was looking for flooring in a kitchen, his answer is kitchen. If the man was looking for it at his home depot, his answer is home depot. If the man was in the loft, he was looking for flooring at a loft and he was not at a home depot. Answer: loft<n><n>Input: If 4 less than the sum of a number and 7 is equal ot 3 times the product of that number and 1/2, which operation does the following equation represent? Choices: Addition Subtraction Multiplication<n><n>### Response<n>If the sum of a number plus 7 equals 3x1/2 then the product of that number is a quarter of that number. The number must be a quarter of an equal number. The number cannot be 1 and 1/4 because that is not a quarter. You cannot have a decimal added to the 3x1/4 because a 1/4 number cannot be divided by a 3 because it is not a whole number division problem. Answer: multiplication<n>

If the total number of strings among the ukuleles, guitars, and violins is 40 strings, how many violins does Francis' family have?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: On each of 7 Mondays, it rained 1.5 centimeters. On each of 9 Tuesdays it rained 2.5 centimeters. Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>* A: Tenacity = Strength<n>* B: Hands = Fingers<n>* C: Coaster = A Surface that is used for a drinks or food<n>* D: Skill = Capability<n>* E: Breaking = A Break<n><n>### Input:"No need to panic," she urged. "We'll do the trick 80% in half the time. How much time do we need?" Choices: A: 40 minutes B: 100 minutes C: 2 hours D: 20 minutes E: 80 minutes<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Explination:<n><n>* A, B: 40-100<n>* C: 2 hours<n>* D: 20 mins<n>* E: 80 mins<n><n>### Input "If I told you 11+2 is 13, what would you say?" Choices: A. I didn't get you, B. I did indeed! C. You're wrong, D. I didn't pay attention.E. Same as you, but with bigger numbers.<n><n>### Response "But you never said that. You said 11+2 = 13+2 or more specifically, 13-2 is 11+2. In fact, if I just said "11+2 =13", what would you say?"Choices: A. You're right, B. You'd be right if I hadn't interrupted you. C. I don't think so, the bigger numbers might be harder to get. D. Same as before - you just messed up by changing the number. E. Well, you may be right about the number, but the problem is that you never said the bigger numbers!<n><n>### Response To Explanation: I don't think you would be right if interrupting him.  He just might get confused and start the whole argument again. Since they are a lot larger numbers you might as well just say he would be right.<n><n>### Input One time in a class: The student asked the teacher. "How do I add 1 + 7? Which method is faster?"
